translation: Because of too much ~; because ~ too much; so ~ that ~
explanation: A conjunction which marks a cause that involves excessive action.
japanese: この教科書は文法を重視するあまり面白くないものになってしまった。
reading: この教科書は文法を 重視[じゅうし]するあまり面白くないものになってしまった。
english: This textbook has turned out to be an uninteresting one because it stressed grammar too much.
extra_notes: 重視する - to take something seriously, to attach importance, to stress

translation: Because of too much ~; because ~ too much; so ~ that ~
explanation: A conjunction which marks a cause that involves excessive action.
japanese: 秋子は恐怖のあまり声も出なかった。
reading: 秋子は 恐怖[きょうふ]のあまり声も出なかった。
english: Because of too much fear, Akiko couldn't even make a sound.
extra_notes: 恐怖 - fear, dread, dismay, terror, horror, scare, panic

translation: Because of too much ~; because ~ too much; so ~ that ~
explanation: A conjunction which marks a cause that involves excessive action.
japanese: 私は喜びのあまり思わず隣の人に抱きついてしまった。
reading: 私は喜びのあまり思わず隣の人に抱きついてしまった。
english: I was so happy that I hugged the person beside me without thinking.

translation: Because of too much ~; because ~ too much; so ~ that ~
explanation: A conjunction which marks a cause that involves excessive action.
japanese: 日本の英語教育は文法が強調されるあまり会話力の養成が疎かになっているようだ。
reading: 日本の英語教育は文法が<ruby title="強調(きょうちょう)"><rb>強調</rb><rt>きょうちょう</rt></ruby>されるあまり会話力の<ruby title="養成(ようせい)"><rb>養成</rb><rt>ようせい</rt></ruby>が<ruby title="疎(おろ)"><rb>疎</rb><rt>おろそ</rt></ruby>かになっているようだ。
english: As for English education in Japan, it seems that because grammar is emphasized too much, the development of  conversational skills is neglected.
extra_notes:
強調 - emphasis, highlight, stress, stressed point
養成 - training, development
疎かにする - to neglect

translation: Because of too much ~; because ~ too much; so ~ that ~
explanation: A conjunction which marks a cause that involves excessive action.
japanese: 今度の会合は形式を重んずるあまり内容が乏しくなってしまった。
reading: 今度の 会合[かいごう]は 形式[けいしき ]を 重[おも]んずるあまり内容が 乏[とぼ]しくなってしまった。
english: The last meeting ended up having little content because it focused too much on formalities.
extra_notes:
会合 - meeting, assembly
形式 - form (as opposed to substance); formality
重んずる - to honor; to honour; to respect; to esteem; to prize
乏しい - meager; scarce; limited; destitute; hard up; lacking; scanty; poor​

translation: The more ~, the more ~
explanation: A structure indicating that something happens in proportion to the increase of extent/degree of action or state.
japanese: 日本語は勉強すれば（勉強）するほど面白くなります。
reading: 日本語は勉強すれば（勉強）するほど面白くなります。
english: The more you study Japanese, the more interesting it will become.

translation: The more ~, the more ~
explanation: A structure indicating that something happens in proportion to the increase of extent/degree of action or state.
japanese: パーティーは人が多ければ多いほど楽しい。
reading: パーティーは人が多ければ多いほど楽しい。
english: At a party the more the merrier.

translation: The more ~, the more ~
explanation: A structure indicating that something happens in proportion to the increase of extent/degree of action or state.
japanese: 機械は簡単{であればある/なら簡単な}ほど壊れにくい。
reading: 機械は簡単{であればある/なら簡単な}ほど壊れにくい。
english: A machine is harder to break, the simpler it is.
extra_notes: The conditional form なら is only used with な-adjectives

translation: The more ~, the more ~
explanation: A structure indicating that something happens in proportion to the increase of extent/degree of action or state.
japanese: この酒は飲めば飲むほど美味しくなります。
reading: この酒は飲めば飲むほど美味しくなります。
english: The more you drink this sake, the tastier it becomes.

translation: The more ~, the more ~
explanation: A structure indicating that something happens in proportion to the increase of extent/degree of action or state.
japanese: 大学はよければよいほど入るのが難しいです。
reading: 大学はよければよいほど入るのが難しいです。
english: The better the university, the harder it is to get in.

translation: The more ~, the more ~
explanation: A structure indicating that something happens in proportion to the increase of extent/degree of action or state.
japanese: アパートは駅に近ければ近いほど（家賃が）高い。
reading: アパートは駅に近ければ近いほど（家賃が）高い。
english: The closer apartments are to the station, the more expensive they are (to rent).

translation: The more ~, the more ~
explanation: A structure indicating that something happens in proportion to the increase of extent/degree of action or state.
japanese: 普段元気なら元気なほど体に気を付けた方がいいですよ。
reading: 普段元気なら元気なほど体に気を付けた方がいいですよ。
english: The healthier you are, the more careful you should be about your health.
extra_notes: The conditional form なら is only used with な-adjectives

translation: Not only ~ but also
explanation: A compound particle/conjunction which is used to connect two nouns or two sentences, the first of which is something normally expected and the second of which is something normally unexpected.
japanese: 日本では子供ばかりか大人さえ漫画を読んでいる。
reading: 日本では子供ばかりか大人さえ漫画を読んでいる。
english: In Japan not only children but even adults are reading comic books.

translation: Not only ~ but also
explanation: A compound particle/conjunction which is used to connect two nouns or two sentences, the first of which is something normally expected and the second of which is something normally unexpected.
japanese: あの人は絵を見て楽しむばかりか、自分でも絵を描く。
reading: あの人は絵を見て楽しむばかりか、自分でも絵を描く。
english: He not only enjoys looking at pictures; he also draws them.

translation: Not only ~ but also
explanation: A compound particle/conjunction which is used to connect two nouns or two sentences, the first of which is something normally expected and the second of which is something normally unexpected.
japanese: アメリカでは大学生ばかりか、中学生、高校生さえ日本語を勉強している。
reading: アメリカでは大学生ばかりか、中学生、高校生さえ日本語を勉強している。
english: In America not only college students but even junior and senior high school students are studying Japanese.

translation: Not only ~ but also
explanation: A compound particle/conjunction which is used to connect two nouns or two sentences, the first of which is something normally expected and the second of which is something normally unexpected.
japanese: 僕の寮の部屋は狭いばかりか、窓さえないんです。
reading: 僕の寮の部屋は狭いばかりか、窓さえないんです。
english: My room in the dorm is not just small; it doesn't even have a window.

translation: Not only ~ but also
explanation: A compound particle/conjunction which is used to connect two nouns or two sentences, the first of which is something normally expected and the second of which is something normally unexpected.
japanese: トムは漢字が読めないばかりか、平仮名さえ読めない。
reading: トムは漢字が読めないばかりか、平仮名さえ読めない。
english: It's not just kanji that Tom cannot read; he cannot read even hiragana.

translation: Not only ~ but also
explanation: A compound particle/conjunction which is used to connect two nouns or two sentences, the first of which is something normally expected and the second of which is something normally unexpected.
japanese: 父は食べるのが大好きなばかりか、料理をするのも大好きです。
reading: 父は食べるのが大好きなばかりか、料理をするのも大好きです。
english: My father not only loves to eat, he also loves to cook.

translation: Should; ought to
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's judgment that someone/something should do something or should be in some state.
japanese: この論文は書き直すべきだ。
reading: この論文は書き直すべきだ。
english: This thesis should be rewritten.

translation: Should; ought to
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's judgment that someone/something should do something or should be in some state.
japanese: そんなことを人に言うべき{では/じゃ}ありません。
reading: そんなことを人に言うべき{では/じゃ}ありません。
english: You shouldn't say that kind of thing to people.

translation: Should; ought to
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's judgment that someone/something should do something or should be in some state.
japanese: 君も来るべきでしたよ。
reading: 君も来るべきでしたよ。
english: You should have come, too.

translation: Should; ought to
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's judgment that someone/something should do something or should be in some state.
japanese: 山田には話すべき{では/じゃ}なかった。
reading: 山田には話すべき{では/じゃ}なかった。
english: I shouldn't have told that to Yamada.

translation: Should; ought to
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's judgment that someone/something should do something or should be in some state.
japanese: 話すべきことは全部話しました。
reading: 話すべきことは全部話しました。
english: I told you everything I should tell you.

translation: Should; ought to
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's judgment that someone/something should do something or should be in some state.
japanese: 自分のことは自分です（る）べきだ。
reading: 自分のことは自分です（る）べきだ。
english: You should look after yourself. (literally: You should do your own business by yourself.)

translation: Should; ought to
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's judgment that someone/something should do something or should be in some state.
japanese: 今、家を買うべきじゃないよ。
reading: 今、家を買うべきじゃないよ。
english: You shouldn't buy a house now.

translation: Should; ought to
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's judgment that someone/something should do something or should be in some state.
japanese: それは課長にも言っておくべきだったね。
reading: それは 課長[かちょう]にも言っておくべきだったね。
english: We should have told that to our boss, too, huh?
extra_notes: 課長 - section manager, section chief

translation: Should; ought to
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's judgment that someone/something should do something or should be in some state.
japanese: 彼は結婚なんかす（る）べきじゃなかったんだ。
reading: 彼は結婚なんかす（る）べきじゃなかったんだ。
english: He shouldn't have married.

translation: Should; ought to
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's judgment that someone/something should do something or should be in some state.
japanese: 我々はもっと創造的であるべきだ。
reading: 我々[われわれ]はもっと 創造的[そうぞうてき]であるべきだ。
english: We should be more creative.
extra_notes: 創造的 - creative

translation: Should; ought to
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's judgment that someone/something should do something or should be in some state.
japanese: この状態が現実であるべきだ。
reading: この状態が現実であるべきだ。
english: This state should be the reality.

translation: Should; ought to
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's judgment that someone/something should do something or should be in some state.
japanese: 調査の結果、驚くべきことが分かった。
reading: 調査の結果、 驚[おどろ]くべきことが分かった。
english: As a result of the investigation, a surprising thing was discovered.

translation: Should; ought to
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's judgment that someone/something should do something or should be in some state.
japanese: 田中は全く軽蔑すべき男だ。
reading: 田中は全く 軽蔑[けいべつ]すべき男だ。
english: Tanaka is indeed a man who you should scorn.

translation: Should; ought to
explanation: An auxiliary which expresses the speaker's judgment that someone/something should do something or should be in some state.
japanese: あるべき所に記述がない。
reading: あるべき所に 記述[きじゅつ]がない。
english: There's no description where there should be one.
extra_notes: 記述 - description

translation: For ~; ~ worth; amount equivalent to ~; portion
explanation: A suffix which indicates the amount of something.
japanese: ガソリンを十ドル分入れておきました。
reading: ガソリンを十ドル分入れておきました。
english: I put in ten dollars worth of gas (in preparation for something).

translation: For ~; ~ worth; amount equivalent to ~; portion
explanation: A suffix which indicates the amount of something.
japanese: 私は今日三日分の仕事を片付けた。
reading: 私は今日三日分の仕事を片付けた。
english: Today I did three days worth of work.

translation: For ~; ~ worth; amount equivalent to ~; portion
explanation: A suffix which indicates the amount of something.
japanese: 金の不足分は小切手で払います。
reading: 金の 不足[ふそく]分は 小切手[こぎって]で払います。
english: I'll pay the remaining amount (literally: the amount for which cash is short) by check.
extra_notes:
不足 - insufficiency; shortage; deficiency; lack; dearth​
小切手 - check

translation: For ~; ~ worth; amount equivalent to ~; portion
explanation: A suffix which indicates the amount of something.
japanese: 会議の資料を六人分用意しておいて下さい。
reading: 会議の資料を六人分用意しておいて下さい。
english: Please get six sets of materials ready for the meeting.

translation: For ~; ~ worth; amount equivalent to ~; portion
explanation: A suffix which indicates the amount of something.
japanese: ここは後でサインをしますので二行分あけておいて下さい。
reading: ここは後でサインをしますので 二行[にぎょう]分あけておいて下さい。
english: Please leave two lines (of space) here because someone will sign there later.
extra_notes: 行 - ぎょう - (counter for) line (i.e. of text); row; verse​

translation: For ~; ~ worth; amount equivalent to ~; portion
explanation: A suffix which indicates the amount of something.
japanese: 私達は四か月分のボーナスをまらった。
reading: 私達は四か月分のボーナスをもらった。
english: We were paid a bonus equivalent to four months pay.

translation: For ~; ~ worth; amount equivalent to ~; portion
explanation: A suffix which indicates the amount of something.
japanese: トラック三台分のごみが出た。
reading: トラック三台分のごみが出た。
english: Three trucks-full of garbage came out.

translation: For ~; ~ worth; amount equivalent to ~; portion
explanation: A suffix which indicates the amount of something.
japanese: 政府は十万人分の食糧を被災地に送った。
reading: 政府は十万人分の 食糧[しょくりょう]を 被災地[ひさいち]に送った。
english: The government sent food for 100,000 people to the disaster-stricken area.
extra_notes: 被災地 - area struck (by some disaster); location of a disaster​

translation: For ~; ~ worth; amount equivalent to ~; portion
explanation: A suffix which indicates the amount of something.
japanese: 学校当局は諸経費の増加分を授業料の値上げでカバーしようとしている。
reading: 学校<ruby title="当局(とうきょく)"><rb>当局</rb><rt>とうきょく</rt></ruby>は<ruby title="諸(しょ)"><rb>諸</rb><rt>しょ</rt></ruby> <ruby title="経費(けいひ)"><rb>経費</rb><rt>けいひ</rt></ruby>の<ruby title="増加(ぞうか)"><rb>増加</rb><rt>ぞうか</rt></ruby> <ruby title="分(ぶん)"><rb>分</rb><rt>ぶん</rt></ruby>を<ruby title="授業(じゅぎょう)"><rb>授業</rb><rt>じゅぎょう</rt></ruby> <ruby title="料(りょう)"><rb>料</rb><rt>りょう</rt></ruby>の値上げでカバーしようとしている。
english: The school authorities are trying to cover the (amount equivalent to the) increase in expenses by raising tuition.
extra_notes: 当局 - authorities; relevant authorities; authorities concerned

translation: But; however; yet; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunction that expresses something that is contrasted with what is expressed in the previous sentence.
japanese: 日本の経済力は伸びている。だが、いつまで続くかは分からない。
reading: 日本の経済力は伸びている。だが、いつまで続くかは分からない。
english: Japanese economic power is growing, but we can't tell how long it will last.
extra_notes: 伸びる - [multi def] to make progress; to develop; to expand; to increase; to improve

translation: But; however; yet; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunction that expresses something that is contrasted with what is expressed in the previous sentence.
japanese: 都会の生活は便利だ。だが、ストレスが多すぎる。
reading: 都会[とかい]の生活は便利だ。だが、ストレスが多すぎる。
english: Urban life is convenient. But there are too many stresses.
extra_notes: 都会 - city

translation: But; however; yet; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunction that expresses something that is contrasted with what is expressed in the previous sentence.
japanese: 私は彼女とは初めて会った。だが、前から知っていたような親しみを感じた。
reading: 私は彼女とは初めて会った。だが、前から知っていたような親しみを感じた。
english: I met her for the first time; but I felt close to her as if I had known her for a long time.
extra_notes: 親しみ - intimacy; affection; familiarity​

translation: But; however; yet; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunction that expresses something that is contrasted with what is expressed in the previous sentence.
japanese: 山本は医者に何度も煙草を辞めるように言われた。だが、辞める気はないらしい。
reading: 山本は医者に何度も煙草を辞めるように言われた。だが、辞める気はないらしい。
english: Yamamoto was told by his doctor to quit smoking, but he doesn't seem to have any intention of quitting.

translation: But; however; yet; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunction that expresses something that is contrasted with what is expressed in the previous sentence.
japanese: あの人には才能がある。だが、その才能を使っていない。
reading: あの人には才能がある。だが、その才能を使っていない。
english: He is talented, but he is not using his talents.

translation: But; however; yet; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunction that expresses something that is contrasted with what is expressed in the previous sentence.
japanese: 今日の試験のために寝ないで勉強した。だが、さっぱり出来なかった。
reading: 今日の試験のために寝ないで勉強した。だが、さっぱり出来なかった。
english: I studied hard for today's exam without sleeping, but I couldn't do it at all.

translation: But; however; yet; nevertheless
explanation: A conjunction that expresses something that is contrasted with what is expressed in the previous sentence.
japanese: 妹はよく勉強するし、頭もいい。だが、成績はなぜかよくない。
reading: 妹はよく勉強するし、頭もいい。だが、成績はなぜかよくない。
english: My younger sister studies hard and she is intelligent, but somehow her grades are not good.
extra_notes: なぜか - somehow, for some reason, without knowing why

translation: However, it doesn't follow from this that ~; but it doesn't mean that ~; because of that
explanation: A coordinate conjunction indicating that even if one accepts a premise expressed in the preceding sentence(s) one cannot jump to an expected conclusion from the premise.
japanese: チェンさんは日本語が苦手だ。テストではいつも半分も出来ない。だからと言って、頭が悪いわけではない。
reading: チェンさんは日本語が苦手だ。テストではいつも半分も出来ない。だからと言って、頭が悪いわけではない。
english: Mr. Cheng is not good at Japanese. On a test he cannot even finish half of it. But it doesn't follow from this that he is not smart.

translation: However, it doesn't follow from this that ~; but it doesn't mean that ~; because of that
explanation: A coordinate conjunction indicating that even if one accepts a premise expressed in the preceding sentence(s) one cannot jump to an expected conclusion from the premise.
japanese: 吉田さんは日本人だ。しかも、小説家だ。だからと言って、日本語が教えられるとは限らない。
reading: 吉田[よしだ]さんは日本人だ。しかも、小説家だ。だからと言って、日本語が教えられるとは限らない。
english: Ms. Yoshida is Japanese. And she is a novelist. But she may not necessarily be able to teach Japanese.

translation: However, it doesn't follow from this that ~; but it doesn't mean that ~; because of that
explanation: A coordinate conjunction indicating that even if one accepts a premise expressed in the preceding sentence(s) one cannot jump to an expected conclusion from the premise.
japanese: ジョンは奥さんのことをちっとも褒めない。時々口をきかないこともある。だからと言って、奥さんを愛していないわけではない。
reading: ジョンは奥さんのことをちっとも 褒[ほ]めない。時々口をきかないこともある。だからと言って、奥さんを愛していないわけではない。
english: John does not praise his wife at all. Sometimes he doesn't talk with her. But it doesn't mean that he doesn't love  her.

translation: However, it doesn't follow from this that ~; but it doesn't mean that ~; because of that
explanation: A coordinate conjunction indicating that even if one accepts a premise expressed in the preceding sentence(s) one cannot jump to an expected conclusion from the premise.
japanese: 僕は毎日運動をしている。食べ物にも注意している。しかし、だからと言って、長生きする保証はない。
reading: 僕は毎日運動をしている。食べ物にも注意している。しかし、だからと言って、長生きする 保証[ほしょう]はない。
english: I am doing exercise every day. I am also paying attention to what I eat. But it doesn't guarantee that I will live long.

translation: However, it doesn't follow from this that ~; but it doesn't mean that ~; because of that
explanation: A coordinate conjunction indicating that even if one accepts a premise expressed in the preceding sentence(s) one cannot jump to an expected conclusion from the premise.
japanese: 日本人は集団行動が好きだと言われる。何をするにも一緒にやる。しかし、だからと言って、個人行動が全くないわけではない。
reading: 日本人は 集団行動[しゅうだんこうどう]が好きだと言われる。何をするにも一緒にやる。しかし、だからと言って、個人行動が全くないわけではない。
english: They say that Japanese like group activities. Whatever they do, they do together. But it is not the case that there are no individual activities.

translation: However, it doesn't follow from this that ~; but it doesn't mean that ~; because of that
explanation: A coordinate conjunction indicating that even if one accepts a premise expressed in the preceding sentence(s) one cannot jump to an expected conclusion from the premise.
japanese: 魚は健康にいい。しかし、だからと言って、魚ばかり食べていたら、体に悪いはずだ。
reading: 魚は健康にいい。しかし、だからと言って、魚ばかり食べていたら、体に悪いはずだ。
english: Fish is good for you. But if you ate nothing but fish, it would be bad for you.

translation: However, it doesn't follow from this that ~; but it doesn't mean that ~; because of that
explanation: A coordinate conjunction indicating that even if one accepts a premise expressed in the preceding sentence(s) one cannot jump to an expected conclusion from the premise.
japanese: 日本語はよく難しい言語だと言われる。文法が複雑だし、漢字を覚えるのも大変だ。だからと言って、外国人が学べないわけではない。
reading: 日本語はよく難しい言語だと言われる。文法が複雑だし、漢字を覚えるのも大変だ。だからと言って、外国人が学べないわけではない。
english: Japanese is often said to be difficult. The grammar is complex and kanji are hard to memorize. But that doesn't mean foreigners cannot learn it.

translation: Just V-ing is enough; can just ~; just by V-ing
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that just doing something is enough for something.
japanese: 君はここに座っているだけでよい。
reading: 君はここに座っているだけでよい。
english: You can just sit here.

translation: Just V-ing is enough; can just ~; just by V-ing
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that just doing something is enough for something.
japanese: 私は筆跡を見ただけで誰が書いたか分かった。
reading: 私は 筆跡[ひっせき]を見ただけで誰が書いたか分かった。
english: I knew who wrote it just by looking at the handwriting.

translation: Just V-ing is enough; can just ~; just by V-ing
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that just doing something is enough for something.
japanese: この植木は二週間に一度水をやるだけでよい。
reading: この 植木[うえき]は二週間に一度水をやるだけでよい。
english: Watering just once every other week is enough for this plant.

translation: Just V-ing is enough; can just ~; just by V-ing
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that just doing something is enough for something.
japanese: この用紙にサインしていただくだけで結構です。
reading: この用紙にサインしていただくだけで結構です。
english: It will be enough if you just sign this form.

translation: Just V-ing is enough; can just ~; just by V-ing
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that just doing something is enough for something.
japanese: 本当に来るだけでいいんですか。
reading: 本当に来るだけでいいんですか。
english: Are you sure that I don't have to do anything except attend?

translation: Just V-ing is enough; can just ~; just by V-ing
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that just doing something is enough for something.
japanese: その会議では私はただ座っているだけでよかった。
reading: その会議では私はただ座っているだけでよかった。
english: At that meeting all I had to do was sit there.

translation: Just V-ing is enough; can just ~; just by V-ing
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that just doing something is enough for something.
japanese: 村上君は一週間勉強しただけであの試験に通ったそうだ。
reading: 村上[むらかみ]君は一週間勉強しただけであの試験に通ったそうだ。
english: I heard that Murakami passed that exam just by studying for one week.

translation: Just V-ing is enough; can just ~; just by V-ing
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that just doing something is enough for something.
japanese: お金を入れてボタンを押すだけで暖かいラーメンが出てくる自動販売機がある。
reading: お金を入れてボタンを押すだけで暖かいラーメンが出てくる自動販売機がある。
english: There is a vending machine which serves hot ramen (literally: from which hot ramen comes out) just by inserting coins and pushing a button.

translation: Just V-ing is enough; can just ~; just by V-ing
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that just doing something is enough for something.
japanese: 頭金一万円を払うだけで品物をお届けします。
reading: 頭金[あたまきん]一万円を払うだけで品物をお届けします。
english: If you just pay 10,000 yen as deposit, we'll deliver the product.

translation: Just V-ing is enough; can just ~; just by V-ing
explanation: A phrase which expresses the idea that just doing something is enough for something.
japanese: 聞くだけで胸が悪くなるような話だ。
reading: 聞くだけで胸が悪くなるような話だ。
english: Just hearing that story makes me sick. (literally: It is a story that makes me sick just by hearing it.)

translation: Full of; filled with; covered with
explanation: A suffix that indicates that something/someone is covered or filled with something undesirable.
japanese: スミスさんはいつも泥だらけの靴を履いています。
reading: スミスさんはいつも 泥[どろ]だらけの靴を 履[は]いています。
english: Mr. Smith is always wearing shoes covered with mud.

translation: Full of; filled with; covered with
explanation: A suffix that indicates that something/someone is covered or filled with something undesirable.
japanese: この作文は間違いだらけです。
reading: この作文は間違いだらけです。
english: This composition is full of mistakes.

translation: Full of; filled with; covered with
explanation: A suffix that indicates that something/someone is covered or filled with something undesirable.
japanese: 長いこと掃除をしていなかったらしく、床も机の上もほこりだらけだった。
reading: 長いこと 掃除[そうじ]をしていなかったらしく、床も机の上もほこりだらけだった。
english: Apparently they have not cleaned the room for a long time, and the floor and the tables were covered with dust.

translation: Full of; filled with; covered with
explanation: A suffix that indicates that something/someone is covered or filled with something undesirable.
japanese: 病院に担ぎ込んだ時、その男の顔は血だらけだった。
reading: 病院に 担[かつ]ぎ込んだ時、その男の顔は血だらけだった。
english: When we carried him into the hospital, the man's face was covered with blood.

translation: Full of; filled with; covered with
explanation: A suffix that indicates that something/someone is covered or filled with something undesirable.
japanese: 泥だらけの足で入って来ないで。
reading: 泥だらけの足で入って来ないで。
english: Don't come in with muddy feet.

translation: Full of; filled with; covered with
explanation: A suffix that indicates that something/someone is covered or filled with something undesirable.
japanese: 借金だらけの生活をしています。
reading: 借金[しゃっきん]だらけの生活をしています。
english: I am living a life with many debts.

translation: Full of; filled with; covered with
explanation: A suffix that indicates that something/someone is covered or filled with something undesirable.
japanese: この貝は砂だらけで食べにくい。
reading: この 貝[かい]は砂だらけで食べにくい。
english: This seashell contains a lot of sand, so eating is difficult.

explanation: A particle which indicates a basic quantity, for each of which certain amount is associated.
japanese: この翻訳は一ページで二千円お払いします。
reading: この翻訳は一ページで二千円お払いします。
english: We will pay 2,000 yen per page for this translation.

explanation: A particle which indicates a basic quantity, for each of which certain amount is associated.
japanese: このアルバイトは一時間で千円払ってくれます。
reading: このアルバイトは一時間で千円払ってくれます。
english: They will pay me 1,000 yen per hour for this part-time job.

explanation: A particle which indicates a basic quantity, for each of which certain amount is associated.
japanese: 昨日は一日で本を五百ページ読んだ。
reading: 昨日は一日で本を五百ページ読んだ。
english: Yesterday I read 500 pages in a day.

explanation: A particle which indicates a basic quantity, for each of which certain amount is associated.
japanese: 食べて飲んで、五人で、七万ぐらいでした。
reading: 食べて飲んで、五人で、七万ぐらいでした。
english: We ate and drank and it cost us about 70,000 yen for five persons.

explanation: A particle which indicates a basic quantity, for each of which certain amount is associated.
japanese: この林檎は一山で二百円です。
reading: この林檎は 一山[ひとやま]で二百円です。
english: These apples are 200 yen for one pile.

translation: Probably
explanation: An auxiliary which indicates the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
japanese: 日本経済は今後も成長を続けるであろう。
reading: 日本経済は 今後[こんご]も成長を続けるであろう。
english: The Japanese economy will, from now on, probably continue to grow.

translation: Probably
explanation: An auxiliary which indicates the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
japanese: このようなブームはもう二度と起こらないであろう。
reading: このようなブームはもう二度と起こらないであろう。
english: Such a boom will probably not happen again.

translation: Probably
explanation: An auxiliary which indicates the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
japanese: この次に起こる地震は非常に大きいであろうと予想される。
reading: この次に起こる地震は非常に大きいであろうと 予想[よそう]される。
english: It is expected that the next earthquake will (probably) be very strong.

translation: Probably
explanation: An auxiliary which indicates the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
japanese: その交渉は極めて困難であろう。
reading: その 交渉[こうしょう]は 極[きわ]めて 困難[こんなん]であろう。
english: That negotiation will probably be very difficult.

translation: Probably
explanation: An auxiliary which indicates the writer's conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
japanese: この辺りは昔、湖だったであろうと思われる。
reading: この 辺[あた]りは昔、湖だったであろうと思われる。
english: It is thought that this area was probably a lake a long time ago.

translation: Be
explanation: A copula which is used in formal writing and formal speech.
japanese: 「坊っちゃん」は漱石の初期の代表作である。
reading: 「坊[ぼ]っちゃん」は 漱石[そうせき]の 初期[しょき]の 代表作[だいひょうさく]である。
english: Botchan is representative of Soseki's early work.
extra_notes: <!--anki-->*Souseki Natsume, famous Japanese novelist

translation: Be
explanation: A copula which is used in formal writing and formal speech.
japanese: 今年の水不足は極めて深刻である。
reading: 今年の 水不足[みずぶそく]は極めて 深刻[しんこく]である。
english: The water shortage this year is extremely serious.

translation: Be
explanation: A copula which is used in formal writing and formal speech.
japanese: 人間は考える葦である。
reading: 人間は考える 葦[あし]である。
english: “Man is a thinking reed.”
extra_notes: *Famous quote by Blaise Pascal, a French philosopher: "Man is but a reed, the most feeble thing in nature, but he is a thinking reed."

translation: Be
explanation: A copula which is used in formal writing and formal speech.
japanese: 日本語があいまいな言語であるというのは誤りである。
reading: 日本語があいまいな言語であるというのは 誤[あやま]りである。
english: (The idea) that Japanese is an ambiguous language is wrong.

translation: Be
explanation: A copula which is used in formal writing and formal speech.
japanese: 大型車に一人で乗るのは不経済である。
reading: 大型車[おおがたしゃ]に一人で乗るのは 不経済[ふけいざい]である。
english: Using a big car for one person is uneconomical.

translation: Be
explanation: A copula which is used in formal writing and formal speech.
japanese: 彼に何度も手紙を書いたが無駄であった。
reading: 彼に何度も手紙を書いたが 無駄[むだ]であった。
english: I wrote him many letters but it was useless.

translation: Be
explanation: A copula which is used in formal writing and formal speech.
japanese: 日本語では文脈から分かることは原則として言わないのである。
reading: 日本語では 文脈[ぶんみゃく]から分かることは 原則[げんそく]として言わないのである。
english: In principle, in Japanese we do not say what is understood from context.

translation: Be
explanation: A copula which is used in formal writing and formal speech.
japanese: 彼らが出来ないのは練習していないからである。
reading: 彼らが出来ないのは練習していないからである。
english: It is because they haven't practiced that they can't do it.

translation: Far from; not just; even
explanation: A conjunction indicating that someone/something is very far from an expected state.
japanese: 私は日本語が話せるどころか、一度も勉強したことがありません。
reading: 私は日本語が話せるどころか、一度も勉強したことがありません。
english: I am far from being able to speak Japanese. I haven't studied it at all.

translation: Far from; not just; even
explanation: A conjunction indicating that someone/something is very far from an expected state.
japanese: ジムは日本語の会話が出来ないどころか、簡単なあいさつも出来ない。
reading: ジムは日本語の会話が出来ないどころか、簡単なあいさつも出来ない。
english: Jim is not just unable to converse in Japanese; he cannot even make simple greetings.

translation: Far from; not just; even
explanation: A conjunction indicating that someone/something is very far from an expected state.
japanese: スミスさんは日本語の新聞が読めるどころか、平仮名も知らない。
reading: スミスさんは日本語の新聞が読めるどころか、平仮名も知らない。
english: Mr. Smith is far from being able to read a Japanese newspaper; he doesn't even know hiragana.

translation: Far from; not just; even
explanation: A conjunction indicating that someone/something is very far from an expected state.
japanese: ジョンソンさんは漢字が書けないどころか、平仮名も書けない。
reading: ジョンソンさんは漢字が書けないどころか、平仮名も書けない。
english: Mr. Johnson is not just unable to write kanji; he cannot write even hiragana.

translation: Far from; not just; even
explanation: A conjunction indicating that someone/something is very far from an expected state.
japanese: あの人は本を読むどころか、新間も読まない。
reading: あの人は本を読むどころか、新聞も読まない。
english: He is far from reading books; he doesn't even read newspapers.

translation: Far from; not just; even
explanation: A conjunction indicating that someone/something is very far from an expected state.
japanese: 私の父は丈夫(な)どころか、寝たきりです。
reading: 私の父は丈夫(な)どころか、寝たきりです。
english: My father is far from being healthy; he is bedridden.

translation: Far from; not just; even
explanation: A conjunction indicating that someone/something is very far from an expected state.
japanese: スミスさんは日本語が書けないどころか、日本語で小説が書けるぐらいだ。
reading: スミスさんは日本語が書けないどころか、日本語で小説が書けるぐらいだ。
english: Mr. Smith is far from being unable to write Japanese; he can even write a novel in Japanese.

translation: Far from; not just; even
explanation: A conjunction indicating that someone/something is very far from an expected state.
japanese: 父は運動をするどころか、家から一歩も出ない。
reading: 父は運動をするどころか、家から一歩も出ない。
english: My father is far from doing exercises; he doesn't even step out of the house.

translation: Far from; not just; even
explanation: A conjunction indicating that someone/something is very far from an expected state.
japanese: 今年の八月は暑いどころか、寒かった。
reading: 今年の八月は暑いどころか、寒かった。
english: This August was far from being hot; it was cold.

translation: Far from; not just; even
explanation: A conjunction indicating that someone/something is very far from an expected state.
japanese: 食事はご馳走どころか、豚のえさみたいだった。
reading: 食事はご馳走どころか、豚のえさみたいだった。
english: The meal was far from being a feast; it was like food for pigs.

translation: I don't know why but; I cannot manage to; just; from what I gather; seem; no matter how ~; I gather that ~; for some reason
explanation: An adverb to indicate that one cannot make a definite statement about something due to lack of hard evidence.
japanese: この文の意昧がどうもよく分からない。
reading: この文の意味がどうもよく分からない。
english: I tried, but I just cannot understand the meaning of this sentence very well.

translation: I don't know why but; I cannot manage to; just; from what I gather; seem; no matter how ~; I gather that ~; for some reason
explanation: An adverb to indicate that one cannot make a definite statement about something due to lack of hard evidence.
japanese: 鈴木さんはどうも京都大学に入りたいらしい。
reading: 鈴木さんはどうも京都大学に入りたいらしい。
english: I gather that Mr. Suzuki wants to enter Kyoto University.

translation: I don't know why but; I cannot manage to; just; from what I gather; seem; no matter how ~; I gather that ~; for some reason
explanation: An adverb to indicate that one cannot make a definite statement about something due to lack of hard evidence.
japanese: あの先生の授業はどうも面白くない。
reading: あの先生の授業はどうも面白くない。
english: I don't know why, but that instructor's class is uninteresting.

translation: I don't know why but; I cannot manage to; just; from what I gather; seem; no matter how ~; I gather that ~; for some reason
explanation: An adverb to indicate that one cannot make a definite statement about something due to lack of hard evidence.
japanese: このごろどうも体の調子がよくないんです。
reading: このごろどうも体の 調子[ちょうし]がよくないんです。
english: I don't know why, but lately I don't feel very good.

translation: I don't know why but; I cannot manage to; just; from what I gather; seem; no matter how ~; I gather that ~; for some reason
explanation: An adverb to indicate that one cannot make a definite statement about something due to lack of hard evidence.
japanese: あの人の日本語はどうも聞きにくい。
reading: あの人の日本語はどうも聞きにくい。
english: I don't know why, but his Japanese is hard to listen to.

translation: I don't know why but; I cannot manage to; just; from what I gather; seem; no matter how ~; I gather that ~; for some reason
explanation: An adverb to indicate that one cannot make a definite statement about something due to lack of hard evidence.
japanese: 先生、この間題の意味がどうもつかめないんです。
reading: 先生、この間題の意味がどうもつかめないんです。
english: Professor, I can't manage to grasp the intent of this problem.

explanation: This definition of 「どうも」 means "quite; really; mostly​"
japanese: こんな田舎に住むのはどうも不便だ。
reading: こんな 田舎[いなか]に住むのはどうも不便だ。
english: It is just inconvenient to live in such countryside.

translation: I don't know why but; I cannot manage to; just; from what I gather; seem; no matter how ~; I gather that ~; for some reason
explanation: An adverb to indicate that one cannot make a definite statement about something due to lack of hard evidence.
japanese: うちの子はテレビばかり見て、どうも本を読まない。
reading: うちの子はテレビばかり見て、どうも本を読まない。
english: I don't know why, but our kids are always watching TV and do not read books.

translation: I don't know why but; I cannot manage to; just; from what I gather; seem; no matter how ~; I gather that ~; for some reason
explanation: An adverb to indicate that one cannot make a definite statement about something due to lack of hard evidence.
japanese: あの先生はどうも厳しいようだ。
reading: あの先生はどうも厳しいようだ。
english: That teacher seems strict to me.

translation: I don't know why but; I cannot manage to; just; from what I gather; seem; no matter how ~; I gather that ~; for some reason
explanation: An adverb to indicate that one cannot make a definite statement about something due to lack of hard evidence.
japanese: ジョンは日本語を話すのは上手だが、読むのはどうも下手なようです。
reading: ジョンは日本語を話すのは上手だが、読むのはどうも下手なようです。
english: John is good at speaking Japanese but for some reason he seems poor at reading it.

translation: I don't know why but; I cannot manage to; just; from what I gather; seem; no matter how ~; I gather that ~; for some reason
explanation: An adverb to indicate that one cannot make a definite statement about something due to lack of hard evidence.
japanese: その男がどうも犯人に違いないと思っていたが、やっぱりそうだった。
reading: その男がどうも犯人に違いないと思っていたが、やっぱりそうだった。
english: I gathered that he must be the one who did it, and my guess was right.

translation: I don't know why but; I cannot manage to; just; from what I gather; seem; no matter how ~; I gather that ~; for some reason
explanation: An adverb to indicate that one cannot make a definite statement about something due to lack of hard evidence.
japanese: 彼女が今朝電車の中で僕に言ったことがどうも気になった。
reading: 彼女が今朝電車の中で僕に言ったことがどうも気になった。
english: What she said to me this morning in the train somehow bothered me.

translation: How ~ (!)
explanation: A structure that indicates an exclamation about the degree to which an action or state takes/took place.
japanese: 兄は病気が治ってどんなに嬉しかったことか。
reading: 兄は病気が治ってどんなに嬉しかったことか。
english: How glad my elder brother was when he recovered from his illness!

translation: How ~ (!)
explanation: A structure that indicates an exclamation about the degree to which an action or state takes/took place.
japanese: 父は母をどんなに愛していたことか。
reading: 父は母をどんなに愛していたことか。
english: How dearly my father loved my mother!

translation: How ~ (!)
explanation: A structure that indicates an exclamation about the degree to which an action or state takes/took place.
japanese: 日本へ行くまで日本がどんなに狭いか分からなかった。
reading: 日本へ行くまで日本がどんなに狭いか分からなかった。
english: I didn't realise how small Japan was until I got to Japan.

translation: How ~ (!)
explanation: A structure that indicates an exclamation about the degree to which an action or state takes/took place.
japanese: 英夫は由美子に結婚を断られた時にどんなに残念に思ったことか。
reading: 英夫[ひでお]は 由美子[ゆみこ]に結婚を 断[ことわ]られた時にどんなに残念に思ったことか。
english: How disappointed Hideo must have felt when Yumiko refused to marry him.

translation: How ~ (!)
explanation: A structure that indicates an exclamation about the degree to which an action or state takes/took place.
japanese: 勉強が嫌いだった良夫には大学に入るのがどんなに難しかったか。
reading: 勉強が嫌いだった 良夫[よしお]には大学に入るのがどんなに難しかったか。
english: For Yoshio, who didn't like to study, how hard it was to enter college!

translation: How ~ (!)
explanation: A structure that indicates an exclamation about the degree to which an action or state takes/took place.
japanese: 圭子はどんなにフランスに留学したかったことか！
reading: 圭子[けいこ]はどんなにフランスに留学したかったことか！
english: How strongly Keiko wanted to study abroad in France!

translation: How ~ (!)
explanation: A structure that indicates an exclamation about the degree to which an action or state takes/took place.
japanese: 学生達はその厳しい先生をどんなに強く憎んだことか！
reading: 学生達はその厳しい先生をどんなに強く 憎[にく]んだことか！
english: How strongly the students hated their strict teacher!

translation: How ~ (!)
explanation: A structure that indicates an exclamation about the degree to which an action or state takes/took place.
japanese: 駅前のアパートはどんなに便利だったことか！
reading: 駅前のアパートはどんなに便利だったことか！
english: How convenient my apartment right in front of the station was!

translation: How ~ (!)
explanation: A structure that indicates an exclamation about the degree to which an action or state takes/took place.
japanese: 一郎は親のもとを離れた時、親がどんなに寂しがったか分からなかった。
reading: 一郎は親[おや]のもとを離[はな]れた時、親がどんなに寂しがったか分からなかった。
english: Ichiro didn't realise how lonely his parents must have felt when he left them.

translation: In any case; anyway; at all events; after all; at all
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's feeling that no matter what s/he does or how s/he does it, the situation will not change.
japanese: 受けても、どうせ、駄目だから、文部省の留学生試験を受けないことにしました。
reading: 受けても、どうせ、駄目だから、 文部省[もんぶしょう]の留学生試験を受けないことにしました。
english: I decided not to try for the Education Ministry's Scholarship, because I'd be doomed to failure.

translation: In any case; anyway; at all events; after all; at all
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's feeling that no matter what s/he does or how s/he does it, the situation will not change.
japanese: どうせ外国旅行をするんなら、若いうちにした方がいい。
reading: どうせ外国旅行をするんなら、若いうちにした方がいい。
english: If you make a trip abroad at all, it's better to do it when you are young.

translation: In any case; anyway; at all events; after all; at all
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's feeling that no matter what s/he does or how s/he does it, the situation will not change.
japanese: どうせこんな沢山の宿題、出来るわけがないから、遊ぶことにしたよ。
reading: どうせこんな沢山の宿題、出来るわけがないから、遊ぶことにしたよ。
english: I can't do this much homework anyway, so I've decided to play.

translation: In any case; anyway; at all events; after all; at all
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's feeling that no matter what s/he does or how s/he does it, the situation will not change.
japanese: 人間はどうせ死ぬんだから、あくせく働いても仕方がない。
reading: 人間はどうせ死ぬんだから、あくせく働いても仕方がない。
english: Since we humans are bound to die, it is no use working hard.

translation: In any case; anyway; at all events; after all; at all
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's feeling that no matter what s/he does or how s/he does it, the situation will not change.
japanese: どうせ捨てられるのに、どうして彼の後を追うの?
reading: どうせ捨てられるのに、どうして彼の後を追うの?
english: Why are you following him, when you are well aware that you are going to be dumped after all?

translation: In any case; anyway; at all events; after all; at all
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's feeling that no matter what s/he does or how s/he does it, the situation will not change.
japanese: どうせあの女性とは結婚出来ないよ。早くあきらめた方がいいよ。
reading: どうせあの女性とは結婚出来ないよ。早くあきらめた方がいいよ。
english: You cannot marry that woman anyway. You'd better give her up as soon as possible.

translation: In any case; anyway; at all events; after all; at all
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's feeling that no matter what s/he does or how s/he does it, the situation will not change.
japanese: Ａ：君はこんなことが分からないのかい? Ｂ：どうせ私は馬鹿ですよ。
reading:
Ａ：君はこんなことが分からないのかい?
Ｂ：どうせ私は馬鹿ですよ。
english:
A: Don't you understand this simple matter?
B: I'm stupid, after all.

translation: In any case; anyway; at all events; after all; at all
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's feeling that no matter what s/he does or how s/he does it, the situation will not change.
japanese: どうせ来週日本へ行きますから、その辞書は日本で買います。
reading: どうせ来週日本へ行きますから、その辞書は日本で買います。
english: I'm going to Japan next week anyway, so I'll buy that dictionary over there.

translation: In ~ manner; after ~ style; a la ~; like
explanation: With an appearance/style/tone/manner of ~.
japanese: 私の家の庭は日本風に大きい石が置いてあります。
reading: 私の家の庭は日本風に大きい石が置いてあります。
english: The yard of my house has big rocks arranged in Japanese style.

translation: In ~ manner; after ~ style; a la ~; like
explanation: With an appearance/style/tone/manner of ~.
japanese: あんな風に勉強していたらいい成績は取れないだろう。
reading: あんな風に勉強していたらいい成績は取れないだろう。
english: If he studies like that, he won't get good grades.

translation: In ~ manner; after ~ style; a la ~; like
explanation: With an appearance/style/tone/manner of ~.
japanese: 私は先生に頭がいいんだからもっと勉強しろという風によく言われた。
reading: 私は先生に頭がいいんだからもっと勉強しろという風によく言われた。
english: I was often told by my teacher that I have to study harder because I am smart.

translation: In ~ manner; after ~ style; a la ~; like
explanation: With an appearance/style/tone/manner of ~.
japanese: Ａ：これはどんな風に持ったらいいんですか。 Ｂ：こんな風に持って下さい。
reading:
Ａ：これはどんな風に持ったらいいんですか。
Ｂ：こんな風に持って下さい。
english:
A: How should I hold this?
B: Please hold it like this.

translation: In ~ manner; after ~ style; a la ~; like
explanation: With an appearance/style/tone/manner of ~.
japanese: あんな風に毎日飲んでいたら、きっと病気になるでしょう。
reading: あんな風に毎日飲んでいたら、きっと病気になるでしょう。
english: If he keeps drinking like that every day, he will surely become ill.

translation: In ~ manner; after ~ style; a la ~; like
explanation: With an appearance/style/tone/manner of ~.
japanese: このカレーライスはインド風に、とても辛くしてあります。
reading: このカレーライスはインド風に、とても辛くしてあります。
english: We have made this curried rice very spicy like an Indian version.

translation: In ~ manner; after ~ style; a la ~; like
explanation: With an appearance/style/tone/manner of ~.
japanese: ジェミーが日本風のお辞儀をした時にはびっくりした。
reading: ジェミーが日本風のお 辞儀[じぎ]をした時にはびっくりした。
english: I was surprised when Jemmy bowed in Japanese style.

translation: In ~ manner; after ~ style; a la ~; like
explanation: With an appearance/style/tone/manner of ~.
japanese: 京子は、今日はお花、あすはダンスという風に、毎日何かを習いに行っている。
reading: 京子は、今日はお花、あすはダンスという風に、毎日何かを習いに行っている。
english: Kyoko goes out every day to take lessons, like flower arrangement one day and dance, the next.

translation: In ~ manner; after ~ style; a la ~; like
explanation: With an appearance/style/tone/manner of ~.
japanese: お母さんが入院なさったという風に人から伺いましたが、いかがですか。
reading: お母さんが入院なさったという風に人から 伺[うかが] いましたが、いかがですか。
english: I heard that your mother has been hospitalized, but how is she?

translation: In ~ manner; after ~ style; a la ~; like
explanation: With an appearance/style/tone/manner of ~.
japanese: 教育改善のためなら、いくらお金を使ってもいい、という風になればいいんですがね。
reading: 教育改善のためなら、いくらお金を使ってもいい、という風になればいいんですがね。
english: I wish things could change in such a way that we can spend as much money as we want to, if it is for educational improvement.

translation: Tend to; be prone to; be apt to; be liable to; be subject to; often
explanation: A suffix to express an undesirable tendency in someone or something.
japanese: 田中君は最近授業を休みがちだ。
reading: 田中君は最近授業を休みがちだ。
english: Tanaka tends to miss classes these days.

translation: Tend to; be prone to; be apt to; be liable to; be subject to; often
explanation: A suffix to express an undesirable tendency in someone or something.
japanese: それは日本に短期間滞在した外国人にありがちな誤解だ。
reading: それは日本に 短期間[たんきかん] 滞在[たいざい]した外国人にありがちな 誤解[ごかい]だ。
english: That's the kind of misunderstanding which foreigners who stay in Japan for a short period of time are subject to.

translation: Tend to; be prone to; be apt to; be liable to; be subject to; often
explanation: A suffix to express an undesirable tendency in someone or something.
japanese: 私は小さい時病気がちでした。
reading: 私は小さい時病気がちでした。
english: I was often ill when I was very young.

translation: Tend to; be prone to; be apt to; be liable to; be subject to; often
explanation: A suffix to express an undesirable tendency in someone or something.
japanese: この辺りは昼間留守がちの家が多い。
reading: この辺りは昼間留守がちの家が多い。
english: Around here many people are often away from their houses during the day. (literally: Around here there are many houses which residents are often away from during the day.)

translation: Tend to; be prone to; be apt to; be liable to; be subject to; often
explanation: A suffix to express an undesirable tendency in someone or something.
japanese: 夏はややもすると塩分が不足しがちだ。
reading: 夏はややもすると 塩分[えんぶん]が不足[ふそく]しがちだ。
english: Our bodies are apt to lack salt in the summer.

translation: Tend to; be prone to; be apt to; be liable to; be subject to; often
explanation: A suffix to express an undesirable tendency in someone or something.
japanese: この時計は最近遅れがちだ。
reading: この時計は最近 遅[おく]れがちだ。
english: This watch tends to run slow these days.

translation: Tend to; be prone to; be apt to; be liable to; be subject to; often
explanation: A suffix to express an undesirable tendency in someone or something.
japanese: 人はともすると自分の都合いいように物事を考えがちだ。
reading: 人はともすると自分の 都合[つごう]いいように物事を考えがちだ。
english: People tend to think (about things) in a way that's convenient for them.

translation: Tend to; be prone to; be apt to; be liable to; be subject to; often
explanation: A suffix to express an undesirable tendency in someone or something.
japanese: 若いうちはとかく物事一途に考えがちだ。
reading: 若いうちはとかく物事<ruby title="一途(いっと)"><rb>一途</rb><rt>いちず</rt></ruby>に考えがちだ。
english: Young people tend to think (about things) too seriously and narrow-mindedly.

translation: Tend to; be prone to; be apt to; be liable to; be subject to; often
explanation: A suffix to express an undesirable tendency in someone or something.
japanese: 私は最近週末もうちを空けがちです。
reading: 私は最近週末もうちを 空[あ]けがちです。
english: These days I seldom stay home even on weekends.

translation: Tend to; be prone to; be apt to; be liable to; be subject to; often
explanation: A suffix to express an undesirable tendency in someone or something.
japanese: これはアメリカ人の学生が犯しがちな間違いだ。
reading: これはアメリカ人の学生が 犯[おか]しがちな間違いだ。
english: This is the kind of mistake which American students are apt to make.

translation: Tend to; be prone to; be apt to; be liable to; be subject to; often
explanation: A suffix to express an undesirable tendency in someone or something.
japanese: 明日は曇りがちの天気でしょう。
reading: 明日は曇りがちの天気でしょう。
english: It will be mostly cloudy tomorrow.

translation: Tend to; be prone to; be apt to; be liable to; be subject to; often
explanation: A suffix to express an undesirable tendency in someone or something.
japanese: 私のクラスには病気がちの学生が何人かいる。
reading: 私のクラスには病気がちの学生が何人かいる。
english: There are some students in my class who often get ill.

translation: Tend to; be prone to; be apt to; be liable to; be subject to; often
explanation: A suffix to express an undesirable tendency in someone or something.
japanese: 彼女は遠慮がちに話した。
reading: 彼女は遠慮がちに話した。
english: She talked hesitantly (literally: with a tendency to hesitate).

translation: Cannot; un—able; can hardly; difficult to; impossible
explanation: An auxiliary adjective which expresses the idea that for someone to do something is virtually impossible or impossible.
japanese: 彼のしたことは許しがたい。
reading: 彼のしたことは許しがたい。
english: What he did is unforgivable.

translation: Cannot; un—able; can hardly; difficult to; impossible
explanation: An auxiliary adjective which expresses the idea that for someone to do something is virtually impossible or impossible.
japanese: この旅行は私にとって忘れがたい思い出になるだろう。
reading: この旅行は私にとって忘れがたい思い出になるだろう。
english: This trip will be an unforgettable one (literally: memory) for me.

translation: Cannot; un—able; can hardly; difficult to; impossible
explanation: An auxiliary adjective which expresses the idea that for someone to do something is virtually impossible or impossible.
japanese: 彼の行為は理解しがたい。
reading: 彼の 行為[こうい]は理解しがたい。
english: His behaviour is hard to understand.

translation: Cannot; un—able; can hardly; difficult to; impossible
explanation: An auxiliary adjective which expresses the idea that for someone to do something is virtually impossible or impossible.
japanese: あの先生は偉すぎて私には近寄りがたい。
reading: あの先生は偉すぎて私には近寄りがたい。
english: That professor is so respected that I can hardly approach him.

translation: Cannot; un—able; can hardly; difficult to; impossible
explanation: An auxiliary adjective which expresses the idea that for someone to do something is virtually impossible or impossible.
japanese: この二つの作品は甲乙付けがたい。
reading: この二つの作品は 甲乙[こうおつ] 付[つ]けがたい。
english: Between these two works, it is hard to say that one is better than the other (literally: differentiate between them).

translation: Cannot; un—able; can hardly; difficult to; impossible
explanation: An auxiliary adjective which expresses the idea that for someone to do something is virtually impossible or impossible.
japanese: このプロジェクトは成功したとは言いがたい。
reading: このプロジェクトは 成功[せいこう]したとは言いがたい。
english: It is hard to say that this project was a success.

translation: Cannot; un—able; can hardly; difficult to; impossible
explanation: An auxiliary adjective which expresses the idea that for someone to do something is virtually impossible or impossible.
japanese: ジョーンズ氏は得がたい人物だ。
reading: ジョーンズ氏は 得[え]がたい 人物[じんぶつ]だ。
english: Mr. Jones is an irreplaceable person (literally: a person hard to get).

translation: Cannot; un—able; can hardly; difficult to; impossible
explanation: An auxiliary adjective which expresses the idea that for someone to do something is virtually impossible or impossible.
japanese: 我々は彼の犯行に関する動かしがたい証拠をつかんだ。
reading: 我々[われわれ]は彼の 犯行[はんこう]に関する 動[うご]かしがたい 証拠[しょうこ]をつかんだ。
english: We obtained an indisputable piece of evidence concerning his crime.

translation: Cannot; un—able; can hardly; difficult to; impossible
explanation: An auxiliary adjective which expresses the idea that for someone to do something is virtually impossible or impossible.
japanese: 私は過去に彼から耐えがたい屈辱を受けた。
reading: 私は過去に彼から 耐[た]えがたい 屈辱[くつじょく]を受けた。
english: I was intolerably humiliated by him in the past. (literally: received an intolerable humiliation from him.)

translation: Contrary to one's expectation; contrary to one's intention; conversely
explanation: An adverb to introduce an event which takes place contrary to one's expectation/intention, or an action or event which is converse to that stated in the preceding sentence or clause.
japanese: 薬を飲んだら、逆に熱が出た。
reading: 薬を飲んだら、逆に熱が出た。
english: Contrary to expectations, when I took medicine, I got a fever.

translation: Contrary to one's expectation; contrary to one's intention; conversely
explanation: An adverb to introduce an event which takes place contrary to one's expectation/intention, or an action or event which is converse to that stated in the preceding sentence or clause.
japanese: 叱られると思ったのに、逆にほめられた。
reading: 叱られると思ったのに、逆にほめられた。
english: I expected to be scolded but, contrary to my expectation, I was praised.

translation: Contrary to one's expectation; contrary to one's intention; conversely
explanation: An adverb to introduce an event which takes place contrary to one's expectation/intention, or an action or event which is converse to that stated in the preceding sentence or clause.
japanese: 会話を強調すると文法が不正確になる。逆に文法を強調すると話せなくなる。
reading: 会話を 強調[きょうちょう]すると文法が 不正確[ふせいかく]になる。逆に文法を強調すると話せなくなる。
english: If we emphasize conversation, their grammar becomes inaccurate. Conversely, if we emphasize grammar, they become unable to speak.

translation: Contrary to one's expectation; contrary to one's intention; conversely
explanation: An adverb to introduce an event which takes place contrary to one's expectation/intention, or an action or event which is converse to that stated in the preceding sentence or clause.
japanese: しばらく練習をしなかったら、逆に成績が伸びた。
reading: しばらく練習をしなかったら、逆に成績が伸びた。
english: I didn't practice for some time; then, contrary to expectations, my performance improved.

translation: Contrary to one's expectation; contrary to one's intention; conversely
explanation: An adverb to introduce an event which takes place contrary to one's expectation/intention, or an action or event which is converse to that stated in the preceding sentence or clause.
japanese: 寝すぎると、元気にならないで、逆に疲れてしまう。
reading: 寝すぎると、元気にならないで、逆に疲れてしまう。
english: If you sleep too much, you won't feel well; instead, you'll feel tired.
extra_notes: The で in this sentence is being used to join the two clauses, sort of like "and."

translation: Contrary to one's expectation; contrary to one's intention; conversely
explanation: An adverb to introduce an event which takes place contrary to one's expectation/intention, or an action or event which is converse to that stated in the preceding sentence or clause.
japanese: 文句を言ってやろうと思っていたら、逆に文句を言われてしまった。
reading: 文句を言ってやろうと思っていたら、逆に文句を言われてしまった。
english: I was thinking of complaining; then, contrary to my intention, I had to listen to complaints (literally: complaints were said (to me)).

translation: Contrary to one's expectation; contrary to one's intention; conversely
explanation: An adverb to introduce an event which takes place contrary to one's expectation/intention, or an action or event which is converse to that stated in the preceding sentence or clause.
japanese: 一生懸命仕事をしたのに、逆に仲間に嫌われてしまった。
reading: 一生懸命仕事をしたのに、逆に仲間に 嫌[きら]われてしまった。
english: I worked very hard, but, contrary to expectations, my peers hated me.

translation: Contrary to one's expectation; contrary to one's intention; conversely
explanation: An adverb to introduce an event which takes place contrary to one's expectation/intention, or an action or event which is converse to that stated in the preceding sentence or clause.
japanese: ガールフレンドを喜ばせようとしたのに、逆に怒らせてしまった。
reading: ガールフレンドを喜ばせようとしたのに、逆に怒らせてしまった。
english: I tried to please my girlfriend, but, contrary to my intention, I made her angry.

translation: Contrary to one's expectation; contrary to one's intention; conversely
explanation: An adverb to introduce an event which takes place contrary to one's expectation/intention, or an action or event which is converse to that stated in the preceding sentence or clause.
japanese: その試験に落ちるだろうと思っていたのに、逆に一番で通ってしまった。
reading: その試験に落ちるだろうと思っていたのに、逆に一番で通ってしまった。
english: I was expecting to fail the exam, but, contrary to my expectation, I passed it in first place.

translation: Contrary to one's expectation; contrary to one's intention; conversely
explanation: An adverb to introduce an event which takes place contrary to one's expectation/intention, or an action or event which is converse to that stated in the preceding sentence or clause.
japanese: 人に親切にすることは一般にいいことだと考えられている。しかし、親切にすることが、逆に人を傷つけることもある。
reading: 人に親切にすることは一般にいいことだと考えられている。しかし、親切にすることが、逆に人を傷つけることもある。
english: In general, being kind to people is considered to be a good thing. However, contrary to one's intention, being kind sometimes hurts people.

translation: Contrary to one's expectation; contrary to one's intention; conversely
explanation: An adverb to introduce an event which takes place contrary to one's expectation/intention, or an action or event which is converse to that stated in the preceding sentence or clause.
japanese: この子は優しくすると付け上がる。逆に厳しくするとすぐ泣く。
reading: この子は優しくすると付け上がる。逆に厳しくするとすぐ泣く。
english: If I try to be gentle to the boy, he takes advantage of my gentleness. Conversely, if I try to be strict, he cries readily.

translation: Contrary to one's expectation; contrary to one's intention; conversely
explanation: An adverb to introduce an event which takes place contrary to one's expectation/intention, or an action or event which is converse to that stated in the preceding sentence or clause.
japanese: いい演技をする為には緊張しすぎてはいけない。しかし、逆にリラックスしすぎてもいい演技は出来ない。
reading: いい 演技[えんぎ]をする為には緊張しすぎてはいけない。しかし、逆にリラックスしすぎてもいい演技は出来ない。
english: In order to perform well, you can't be too tense. But, conversely, if you are too relaxed, you can't perform well, either.

translation: The ~, the ~; as; to the extent
explanation: A particle which indicates the extent or the degree to which someone/something does something or is in some state.
japanese: この音楽は舞台に近いほど聞きやすい。
reading: この音楽は 舞台[ぶたい]に近いほど聞きやすい。
english: The closer (you sit) to the stage, the easier this music is to hear.

translation: The ~, the ~; as; to the extent
explanation: A particle which indicates the extent or the degree to which someone/something does something or is in some state.
japanese: 上空に行くほど酸素が薄くなる。
reading: 上空[じょうくう]に行くほど 酸素[さんそ]が 薄[うす]くなる。
english: Oxygen is less dense at higher altitudes. (literally: Oxygen becomes thinner as you go higher / the extent to which you go higher in the air.)

translation: The ~, the ~; as; to the extent
explanation: A particle which indicates the extent or the degree to which someone/something does something or is in some state.
japanese: 私は難しい仕事ほどやる気が出てくる。
reading: 私は難しい仕事ほどやる気が出てくる。
english: I get more motivated by a harder job.

translation: The ~, the ~; as; to the extent
explanation: A particle which indicates the extent or the degree to which someone/something does something or is in some state.
japanese: 子供は小言を言うほど反発するものだ。
reading: 子供は 小言[こごと]を言うほど 反発[はんぱつ]するものだ。
english: The more you nag children, the more they disobey you.

translation: The ~, the ~; as; to the extent
explanation: A particle which indicates the extent or the degree to which someone/something does something or is in some state.
japanese: 私は静かなほど落ち着かない。
reading: 私は静かなほど落ち着かない。
english: The quieter it is, the more uneasy I feel.

translation: The ~, the ~; as; to the extent
explanation: A particle which indicates the extent or the degree to which someone/something does something or is in some state.
japanese: 駅に近くなるほど家賃が高くなる。
reading: 駅に近くなるほど家賃が高くなる。
english: The closer to the station, the higher the rent.

translation: The ~, the ~; as; to the extent
explanation: A particle which indicates the extent or the degree to which someone/something does something or is in some state.
japanese: 運動するほど体の調子が変になる。
reading: 運動するほど体の調子が変になる。
english: The more I exercise, the worse I feel.

translation: The ~, the ~; as; to the extent
explanation: A particle which indicates the extent or the degree to which someone/something does something or is in some state.
japanese: 元気な人ほど無理をしがちだ。
reading: 元気な人ほど無理をしがちだ。
english: Stronger people tend to strain themselves more.

translation: The ~, the ~; as; to the extent
explanation: A particle which indicates the extent or the degree to which someone/something does something or is in some state.
japanese: あまり働かない者ほど不平が多い。
reading: あまり働かない者ほど 不平[ふへい]が多い。
english: Lazier people complain more.

translation: Other than; except (for); but; besides; as well as
explanation: A dependent noun which means "something/someone other than".
japanese: 山田さん以外の人はみんなそのことを知っています。
reading: 山田さん以外の人はみんなそのことを知っています。
english: Everybody except Yamada knows it.

translation: Other than; except (for); but; besides; as well as
explanation: A dependent noun which means "something/someone other than".
japanese: 日本語以外に何か外国語が話せますか。
reading: 日本語以外に何か外国語が話せますか。
english: Can you speak any foreign language besides Japanese?

translation: Other than; except (for); but; besides; as well as
explanation: A dependent noun which means "something/someone other than".
japanese: 私には酒を飲む以外に何も楽しみがない。
reading: 私には酒を飲む以外に何も楽しみがない。
english: I have nothing to enjoy other than drinking.

translation: Other than; except (for); but; besides; as well as
explanation: A dependent noun which means "something/someone other than".
japanese: 私は日本酒以外の酒は飲まない。
reading: 私は 日本酒[にほんしゅ]以外の酒は飲まない。
english: I do not drink any alcohol but sake.

translation: Other than; except (for); but; besides; as well as
explanation: A dependent noun which means "something/someone other than".
japanese: 我々の会社では現在オーストラリア以外の国と取引はない。
reading: 我々の会社では現在オーストラリア以外の国と取引はない。
english: At present our company is not dealing with any countries but Australia.

translation: Other than; except (for); but; besides; as well as
explanation: A dependent noun which means "something/someone other than".
japanese: アメリカ以外の国からも沢山研究者が来た。
reading: アメリカ以外の国からも沢山研究者が来た。
english: Many researchers came from countries other than America, too.

translation: Other than; except (for); but; besides; as well as
explanation: A dependent noun which means "something/someone other than".
japanese: 原因はこれ以外に考えられない。
reading: 原因はこれ以外に考えられない。
english: I can't think of any causes other than this.

translation: Other than; except (for); but; besides; as well as
explanation: A dependent noun which means "something/someone other than".
japanese: 私は散歩以外にも毎日軽い運動をしている。
reading: 私は散歩以外にも毎日軽い運動をしている。
english: I do (other) light exercise every day as well as taking a walk.

translation: Other than; except (for); but; besides; as well as
explanation: A dependent noun which means "something/someone other than".
japanese: ここで待っている以外ない。
reading: ここで待っている以外ない。
english: There is nothing to do but wait here.

translation: Other than; except (for); but; besides; as well as
explanation: A dependent noun which means "something/someone other than".
japanese: 安い以外に何かいいことがありますか。
reading: 安い以外に何かいいことがありますか。
english: Is there any merit besides the price (literally: besides the fact that it is cheap)?

translation: Other than; except (for); but; besides; as well as
explanation: A dependent noun which means "something/someone other than".
japanese: この分は少し漢字の間違いがあるが、それ以外は完全だ。
reading: この分は少し漢字の間違いがあるが、それ以外は完全だ。
english: This sentence (or passage) contains a few kanji mistakes, but other than that, it is perfect.

translation: Other than; except (for); but; besides; as well as
explanation: A dependent noun which means "something/someone other than".
japanese: 従業員以外立入禁止
reading: 従業員[じゅうぎょういん]以外立入禁止
english: [Door sign] Employees only. (literally: Entry of those other than employees is prohibited.)

translation: Since; now that; once; if ~ at all; as long as; so long as
explanation: A conjunction indicating the speaker/writer's feeling that there should be a very strong logical/natural connection between wht precedes the conjunction and what follows it.
japanese: 日本に来た以上（は）、日本語をしっかり勉強したい。
reading: 日本に来た以上（は）、日本語をしっかり勉強したい。
english: Since I came to Japan, I would like to study Japanese hard.

translation: Since; now that; once; if ~ at all; as long as; so long as
explanation: A conjunction indicating the speaker/writer's feeling that there should be a very strong logical/natural connection between wht precedes the conjunction and what follows it.
japanese: 学生である以上（は）、勉強すべきだ。
reading: 学生である以上（は）、勉強すべきだ。
english: So long as you are a student, you should study.

translation: Since; now that; once; if ~ at all; as long as; so long as
explanation: A conjunction indicating the speaker/writer's feeling that there should be a very strong logical/natural connection between wht precedes the conjunction and what follows it.
japanese: 日本語を始めた以上、よく話せて、聞けて、読めて、書けるようになるまで頑張ります。
reading: 日本語を始めた以上、よく話せて、聞けて、読めて、書けるようになるまで頑張ります。
english: Now that I have begun to study Japanese, I will hang in there until I can speak and understand what I hear, and read and write well.

translation: Since; now that; once; if ~ at all; as long as; so long as
explanation: A conjunction indicating the speaker/writer's feeling that there should be a very strong logical/natural connection between wht precedes the conjunction and what follows it.
japanese: 新車を買う以上は、出来るだけ燃費のいいのを買いたいです。
reading: 新車を買う以上は、出来るだけ 燃費[ねんぴ]のいいのを買いたいです。
english: If I buy a new car at all, I would like to buy one with good gas mileage.

translation: Since; now that; once; if ~ at all; as long as; so long as
explanation: A conjunction indicating the speaker/writer's feeling that there should be a very strong logical/natural connection between wht precedes the conjunction and what follows it.
japanese: 親である以上、子供の教育に関心があるのは当然でしょう。
reading: 親である以上、子供の教育に 関心[かんしん]があるのは 当然[とうぜん]でしょう。
english: If you are any sort of parent, you should be interested in your child's education.

translation: Since; now that; once; if ~ at all; as long as; so long as
explanation: A conjunction indicating the speaker/writer's feeling that there should be a very strong logical/natural connection between wht precedes the conjunction and what follows it.
japanese: 貰った以上は、あなたが何と言おうと、私の物です。
reading: 貰った以上は、あなたが何と言おうと、私の物です。
english: Now that you have given this to me, it is mine, no matter what you say.

translation: Since; now that; once; if ~ at all; as long as; so long as
explanation: A conjunction indicating the speaker/writer's feeling that there should be a very strong logical/natural connection between wht precedes the conjunction and what follows it.
japanese: 体をよく動かしている以上は、人間の体は衰えないらしい。
reading: 体をよく動かしている以上は、人間の体は衰えないらしい。
english: So long as you are very active, your body seems to stay strong.

translation: Since; now that; once; if ~ at all; as long as; so long as
explanation: A conjunction indicating the speaker/writer's feeling that there should be a very strong logical/natural connection between wht precedes the conjunction and what follows it.
japanese: 人と約束した以上は、それを守らなければならない。
reading: 人と約束した以上は、それを守らなければならない。
english: Once you have made a promise to someone, you have to keep it.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: アメリカ人の目から見ると、日本の社会はいかにも閉鎖的だ。
reading: アメリカ人の目から見ると、日本の社会はいかにも 閉鎖的[へいさてき]だ。
english: From an American perspective, Japanese society is indeed closed.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: 外は雪が降っていて、いかにも寒そうだ。
reading: 外は雪が降っていて、いかにも寒そうだ。
english: It is snowing outside, and it looks really cold.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: 彼の書斎の本棚には古今東西の本が詰まっていて、いかにも学者の部屋らしい。
reading: 彼の 書斎[しょさい]の本棚には 古今東西[ここんとうざい]の本が 詰[つ]まっていて、いかにも学者の部屋らしい。
english: The bookshelves of his study room are packed with books of all ages and countries, and it surely looks like a scholar's room.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: 先生は最近いかにもお忙しいよう / 様子だ。
reading: 先生は最近いかにもお忙しいよう / 様子だ。
english: These days the professor appears to be really busy.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: 日本人は集団行動がいかにも好きではあるが、個人行動をしないわけではない。
reading: 日本人は集団行動がいかにも好きではあるが、個人行動をしないわけではない。
english: The Japanese indeed like group behaviour, but it is not the case that they do not behave individually.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: 彼はいかにも紳士であるかのように振る舞っているが、なかなかの策士だ。
reading: 彼はいかにも 紳士[しんし]であるかのように振る舞っているが、なかなかの 策士[さくし]だ。
english: He is behaving as if he were truly a gentleman, but he is quite calculated.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: 彼の発想はいかにも日本的だ。
reading: 彼の 発想[はっそう]はいかにも日本的だ。
english: His manner of thinking is very Japanese.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: その教授の知識はいかにも百科全書的だ。
reading: その 教授[きょうじゅ]の知識はいかにも 百科全書[ひゃっかぜんしょ]的だ。
english: The professor's knowledge is truly encyclopedic.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: デーヴィッドは文部省の奨学金が貰えて、いかにも嬉しそうだった。
reading: デーヴィッドは 文部省[もんぶしょう]の奨学金が貰えて、いかにも嬉しそうだった。
english: David was able to get a Ministry of Education scholarship and he looked really happy about it.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: 父は退院して、いかにも元気そうになった。
reading: 父は 退院[たいきん]して、いかにも元気そうになった。
english: My father left the hospital and became really healthy-looking.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: 彼女は明るく、陽気で、いかにもアメリカ人らしい。
reading: 彼女は明るく、陽気[ようき]で、いかにもアメリカ人らしい。
english: She is light-hearted and cheerful, and is truly like an American.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: 僕の大学の友人はいかにも金持ちらしく、いつも洒落た物を着ている。
reading: 僕の大学の友人はいかにも金持ちらしく、いつも 洒落[しゃれ]た物を着ている。
english: A friend of mine in college appears to be truly rich, and is always wearing fancy clothes.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: ジョンは恋人と別れて、いかにも落ち込んでいるようだった。
reading: ジョンは 恋人[こいびと]と別れて、いかにも落ち込んでいるようだった。
english: John split up with his girlfriend and looked truly depressed.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: みゆきは母を失って、いかにも悲しんでいる様子だった。
reading: みゆきは母を失って、いかにも悲しんでいる様子だった。
english: Miyuki lost her mother and looked really saddened.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: いかにもおっしゃる通りです。
reading: いかにもおっしゃる通りです。
english: It is indeed as you have said.

translation: Really; truly; indeed
explanation: An adverb that indicates the speaker/writer's emotive conviction.
japanese: 日本語はいかにも難しい言語ではあるが、マスター出来ないわけではない。
reading: 日本語はいかにも難しい言語ではあるが、マスター出来ないわけではない。
english: Japanese is indeed a difficult language, but it is not the case that you cannot master it.

translation: (don't) V.; No -ing; (not) to V
explanation: Verb forms which indicate commands or requests.
japanese: もうよせよ。
reading: もうよせよ。
english: Stop it now.

translation: (don't) V.; No -ing; (not) to V
explanation: Verb forms which indicate commands or requests.
japanese: ここには十二月三十一日までに払えと書いてある。
reading: ここには十二月三十一日までに払えと書いてある。
english: It says here to pay before December 31.

translation: (don't) V.; No -ing; (not) to V
explanation: Verb forms which indicate commands or requests.
japanese: 黙れ！
reading: 黙れ！
english: Shut up!

translation: (don't) V.; No -ing; (not) to V
explanation: Verb forms which indicate commands or requests.
japanese: 動くな！
reading: 動くな！
english: Don't move!

translation: (don't) V.; No -ing; (not) to V
explanation: Verb forms which indicate commands or requests.
japanese: 山中首相は即時退陣せよ！[A demonstrator's placard]
reading: 山中<ruby title="首相(しゅしょう)"><rb>首相</rb><rt>しゅしょう</rt></ruby>は 即時[そくじ] 退陣[たいじん]せよ！
english: Yamanaka must go! (literally: Prime Minister Yamanaka must leave his office immediately!) [A demonstrator's placard]

translation: (don't) V.; No -ing; (not) to V
explanation: Verb forms which indicate commands or requests.
japanese: 次の分を英訳せよ。
reading: 次の分を 英訳[えいやく]せよ。
english: Translate the following sentences into English. [An examination direction]

translation: (don't) V.; No -ing; (not) to V
explanation: Verb forms which indicate commands or requests.
japanese: 次の質問に答えよ。[An examination direction]
reading: 次の質問に答えよ。[An examination direction]
english: Answer the following questions.

translation: (don't) V.; No -ing; (not) to V
explanation: Verb forms which indicate commands or requests.
japanese: 乗るなら飲むな。飲んだら乗るな。
reading: 乗るなら飲むな。飲んだら乗るな。
english: If you drive, don't drink. If you drink, don't drive.

translation: (don't) V.; No -ing; (not) to V
explanation: Verb forms which indicate commands or requests.
japanese: 現金は送るなと書いてある。
reading: 現金[げんきん]は送るなと書いてある。
english: It says (literally: is written) not to send cash.

translation: (don't) V.; No -ing; (not) to V
explanation: Verb forms which indicate commands or requests.
japanese: 課長にあまりタクシーは使うなと言われた。
reading: 課長にあまりタクシーは使うなと言われた。
english: I was told by my boss not to use taxis often.

grammar_point: 一方で（は） ~ 他方で（は）
translation: On the one hand ~, on the other hand
explanation: A structure used to describe two concurring, contrastive actions/states of someone or something.
japanese: 神田先生は、一方では大学で物理学を教えながら、他方では日本語の研究をなさっている。
reading: 神田[かんだ]先生は、一方では大学で 物理学[ぶつりがく]を教えながら、他方では日本語の研究をなさっている。
english: Professor Kanda teaches physics at college on the one hand and does research on Japanese language on the other.

grammar_point: 一方で（は） ~ 他方で（は）
translation: On the one hand ~, on the other hand
explanation: A structure used to describe two concurring, contrastive actions/states of someone or something.
japanese: あの男は、一方では静かな日本画を描いたりしているが、他方ではサッカーのような激しいスポーツをしている。
reading: あの男は、一方では静かな 日本画[にほんが]を描いたりしているが、他方ではサッカーのような 激[はげ]しいスポーツをしている。
english: That man draws quiet Japanese paintings on the one hand, but plays a very competitive sport like soccer on the other.

grammar_point: 一方で（は） ~ 他方で（は）
translation: On the one hand ~, on the other hand
explanation: A structure used to describe two concurring, contrastive actions/states of someone or something.
japanese: Ｘ氏は、一方で慈善事業をやりながら、他方でかなりあくどい商売をしているという噂だ。
reading: Ｘ氏は、一方で 慈善事業[じぜんじぎょう]をやりながら、他方でかなりあくどい 商売[しょうばい]をしているという 噂[うわさ]だ。
english: On one hand, Mr. X is engaged in charities, but, on the other hand, rumour has it that he is engaged in a ruthless business.

grammar_point: 一方で（は） ~ 他方で（は）
translation: On the one hand ~, on the other hand
explanation: A structure used to describe two concurring, contrastive actions/states of someone or something.
japanese: あの大統領は、一方では減税を約束しておきながら、他方では側近の税金の無駄使いをあまり重要視していない。
reading: あの大統領は、一方では 減税[げんぜい]を約束しておきながら、他方では 側近[そっきん]の 税金[ぜいきん]の無駄使いをあまり 重要視[じゅうようし]していない。
english: The President has promised tax-cuts. But on the other hand he doesn't think much about his associates' waste of taxpayers' money.

grammar_point: 一方で（は） ~ 他方で（は）
translation: On the one hand ~, on the other hand
explanation: A structure used to describe two concurring, contrastive actions/states of someone or something.
japanese: 留守番電話は、一方ではかかる方にもかける方にも便利な面もあるが、他方ではお互いに直接話が出来ないから、不自然な面もある。
reading: 留守番電話は、一方ではかかる方にもかける方にも便利な 面[めん]もあるが、他方ではお互いに 直接話[ちょくせつばなし]が出来ないから、不自然な面もある。
english: The answering machine is, on the one hand, very convenient for both a person who calls and a person who is called, but, on the other hand, unnatural because you can't talk directly with the other person.

grammar_point: 一方で（は） ~ 他方で（は）
translation: On the one hand ~, on the other hand
explanation: A structure used to describe two concurring, contrastive actions/states of someone or something.
japanese: ストレスは、一方では害になることもあるが、他方では生活のいい刺激にもなるそうだ。
reading: ストレスは、一方では害になることもあるが、他方では生活のいい 刺激[しげき]にもなるそうだ。
english: It is said that stress is sometimes harmful for humans, but, on the other hand, it also seems to be a good stimulus for human life.

grammar_point: 一方で（は） ~ 他方で（は）
translation: On the one hand ~, on the other hand
explanation: A structure used to describe two concurring, contrastive actions/states of someone or something.
japanese: 外国生活は、一方では新しい文化に接することが出来て楽しい面もあるが、他方ではカルチャーショックで大変困ることもある。
reading: 外国生活は、一方では新しい文化に 接[せっ]することが出来て楽しい面もあるが、他方ではカルチャーショックで大変困ることもある。
english: Life in a foreign country is, on the one hand, enjoyable because one can encounter a new culture, but, on the other hand, it is sometimes hard because of culture shock.

translation: From the viewpoint of; for (the sake of); for (the reason); in (terms of); relating to; in –ing
explanation: A suffix which indicates the idea of "from the viewpoint of," "for the sake of," "for the reason," or "in terms of".
japanese: この映画は教育上よくない。
reading: この映画は教育上よくない。
english: This film is not good from an educational point of view.

translation: From the viewpoint of; for (the sake of); for (the reason); in (terms of); relating to; in –ing
explanation: A suffix which indicates the idea of "from the viewpoint of," "for the sake of," "for the reason," or "in terms of".
japanese: 便宜上私がこの部屋の鍵を預かっているんです。
reading: 便宜[べんぎ]上私がこの部屋の鍵を 預[あず]かっているんです。
english: I keep the key to this room for the sake of convenience.

translation: From the viewpoint of; for (the sake of); for (the reason); in (terms of); relating to; in –ing
explanation: A suffix which indicates the idea of "from the viewpoint of," "for the sake of," "for the reason," or "in terms of".
japanese: 時間の制約上細かい説明は省略させていただきます。
reading: 時間の 制約[せいやく]上細かい説明は省略させていただきます。
english: I will skip a detailed explanation for lack of time (literally: time limitation).

translation: From the viewpoint of; for (the sake of); for (the reason); in (terms of); relating to; in –ing
explanation: A suffix which indicates the idea of "from the viewpoint of," "for the sake of," "for the reason," or "in terms of".
japanese: 計算上はこれで正しい。
reading: 計算[けいさん]上はこれで正しい。
english: In terms of calculation, this is correct.

translation: From the viewpoint of; for (the sake of); for (the reason); in (terms of); relating to; in –ing
explanation: A suffix which indicates the idea of "from the viewpoint of," "for the sake of," "for the reason," or "in terms of".
japanese: 健康上の理由で引退することにした。
reading: 健康上の理由で 引退[いんたい]することにした。
english: I've decided to retire for health reasons (literally: for a reason relating to my health).

translation: From the viewpoint of; for (the sake of); for (the reason); in (terms of); relating to; in –ing
