english: Taeko was forced to marry. (literally: A marriage which was against Taeko's will was forced upon her.)

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: 浩は両親の期待に反して高校を出てからコックになった。
reading: 浩は両親の期待に反して高校を出てからコックになった。
english: Contrary to his parents' wishes, Hiroshi became a chef after finishing high school.

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: 彼は自分の意思に反して賄賂を受け取ってしまった。
reading: 彼は自分の意思に反して 賄賂[わいろ]を受け取ってしまった。
english: He was forced to accept a bribe. (literally: He received a bribe against his will.)

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: この規則に反して従業員を働かせた場合は一か月の営業停止になる。
reading: この規則に反して従業員を 働[はたら]かせた場合は一か月の 営業停止[えいぎょうていし]になる。
english: Your business will be suspended for one month if you work your employees in violation of these rules.

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: 奥村さんのうちはご主人が無口なのに反して奥さんが人一倍のおしゃべりだ。
reading: 奥村[おくむら]さんのうちはご主人が無口なのに反して奥さんが 人一倍[ひといちばい]のおしゃべりだ。
english: In Okumura's family, whereas the husband is quiet, the wife is very talkative.

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: 日本での初等教育は生徒に知識を与えることに主眼が置かれている。これに反して、アメリカでは生徒の創造性や個性を伸ばすことに重点が置かれている。
reading: 日本での 初等教育[しょとうきょういく]は 生徒[せいと]に知識を 与[あた]えることに 主眼[しゅがん]が 置[お]かれている。これに反して、アメリカでは 生徒[せいと]の 創造性[そうぞうせい]や 個性[こせい]を伸ばすことに 重点[じゅうてん]が置かれている。
english: The chief aim of elementary education in Japan is to provide students with knowledge. In America, in contrast (to this), emphasis is put on increasing students' creativity and individual talents.

translation: Against; contrary to; in contrast to; in violation of; while; whereas
explanation: Contrary to or in contrast to.
japanese: 今回の選挙は一般の予想に反する結果に終わった。
reading: 今回の 選挙[せんきょ]は一般の予想に反する結果に終わった。
english: The election this time ended up with results which were against the general prediction.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: あの人の言葉は美辞麗句にほかならない。
reading: あの人の言葉は美辞麗句にほかならない。
english: His words are nothing but flowery words.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 日本語を勉強しているのは将来日本で仕事をしたいからにほかならない。
reading: 日本語を勉強しているのは将来日本で仕事をしたいからにほかならない。
english: The reason that I am studying Japanese is simply because I want to work in Japan in the future.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 外国語学習はほかの国の人の考え方を学ぶことにほならない。
reading: 外国語学習はほかの国の人の考え方を学ぶことにほならない。
english: Foreign language learning is nothing but learning about the ways people in other countries think.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: モーツァルトの音楽は天使の声にほかならない。
reading: モーツァルトの音楽は天使の声にほかならない。
english: Mozart's music is nothing but an angel's voice.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 結婚は人生の墓場にほかならない。
reading: 結婚は人生の墓場にほかならない。
english: Marriage is nothing but a graveyard of life.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 彼の言動は自己宣伝にほかならない。
reading: 彼の言動は自己宣伝にほかならない。
english: His speech and behaviour are nothing but self-advertisement.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 親が子供を厳しくしつけるのは子供を愛しているからにほかならない。
reading: 親が子供を厳しくしつけるのは子供を愛しているからにほかならない。
english: The reason why parents discipline their children strictly is simply because they love their children.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 彼女が僕に寄って来るのは僕を利用したいからにほかならない。
reading: 彼女が僕に寄って来るのは僕を利用したいからにほかならない。
english: The reason why she comes close to me is simply because she wants to use me.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 私の日本語がこれほど上達したのは大学の時の日本語の先生のおかげにほかならない。
reading: 私の日本語がこれほど上達したのは大学の時の日本語の先生のおかげにほかならない。
english: The reason why my Japanese made such progress is simply because of my college Japanese instructor.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: この大学の学生の質がいいのは選抜が厳しいからにほかならない。
reading: この大学の学生の質がいいのは選抜が厳しいからにほかならない。
english: The reason why the student quality of this college is so good is simply because the selection is tough.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: 核兵器の使用は人類の破滅を招くことにほかならない。
reading: 核兵器の使用は人類の破滅を招くことにほかならない。
english: The use of nuclear weapons invites nothing but the annihilation of humanity.

translation: Be nothing but ~; be simply ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to indicate that an action/state mentioned in the topic phrase or clause is nothing but something.
japanese: ほかならない君のためだから、やってあげよう。
reading: ほかならない君のためだから、やってあげよう。
english: It's for you of all people, so I'll do it.

translation: Not limited to ~ (but also); not only ~ (but also)
explanation: Not limiting something to ~.
japanese: 見合い結婚は日本に限らずほかの国でも行われている。
reading: 見合い結婚は日本に限らずほかの国でも行われている。
english: Arranged marriage is not limited to Japan; it is practiced in other countries, too.

translation: Not limited to ~ (but also); not only ~ (but also)
explanation: Not limiting something to ~.
japanese: 音楽はクラシックに限らず何でも聞きます。
reading: 音楽はクラシックに限らず何でも聞きます。
english: Talking about music, I listen to any music, not just classical music.

translation: Not limited to ~ (but also); not only ~ (but also)
explanation: Not limiting something to ~.
japanese: このバーは男性だけに限らず女性の間にも人気がある。
reading: このバーは男性だけに限らず女性の間にも人気がある。
english: This bar is popular not only among men but also among women.

translation: Not limited to ~ (but also); not only ~ (but also)
explanation: Not limiting something to ~.
japanese: 果物は何に限らず好きです。
reading: 果物は何に限らず好きです。
english: I like any kind of fruit.

translation: Not limited to ~ (but also); not only ~ (but also)
explanation: Not limiting something to ~.
japanese: 何事に限らず仕事は誠意をもって行うことが大切だ。
reading: 何事に限らず仕事は誠意をもって行うことが大切だ。
english: Whatever you do, it is important to do it with sincerity.
extra_notes: 何＊に限らず usually has some type of "whatever/whichever/no matter" definition, though it doesn't seem to be an official phrase

translation: (X) of all (X's); only
explanation: A compound particle to show that only X is different from others.
japanese: うちの子供に限ってそんなひどいことはしませんよ。
reading: うちの子供に限ってそんなひどいことはしませんよ。
english: Our child, of all children, would not do such a terrible thing.

translation: (X) of all (X's); only
explanation: A compound particle to show that only X is different from others.
japanese: 中野先生はたいてい研究室にいらっしゃるのに、今日に限っていらっしゃらなかった。
reading: 中野先生はたいてい研究室にいらっしゃるのに、今日に限っていらっしゃらなかった。
english: Professor Nakano is usually in his office, but today, of all days, he wasn't there.

translation: (X) of all (X's); only
explanation: A compound particle to show that only X is different from others.
japanese: 傘を持って来ない日に限って雨が降るんですよ。
reading: 傘を持って来ない日に限って雨が降るんですよ。
english: Only on the day when I don't bring my umbrella, it rains, you know.

translation: (X) of all (X's); only
explanation: A compound particle to show that only X is different from others.
japanese: 急ぐ時に限って、バスがなかなか来ない。
reading: 急ぐ時に限って、バスがなかなか来ない。
english: Of all times, when I am in a hurry, the bus doesn't come for ages.

translation: (X) of all (X's); only
explanation: A compound particle to show that only X is different from others.
japanese: 嫌なことがある時に限って、嫌なことが重なる。
reading: 嫌なことがある時に限って、嫌なことが重なる。
english: Only when something unpleasant happens, do other unpleasant things occur.

translation: (X) of all (X's); only
explanation: A compound particle to show that only X is different from others.
japanese: この小説家の書いたものに限って、つまらないものはない。
reading: この小説家の書いたものに限って、つまらないものはない。
english: Of all the works written by this novelist, none of them are boring.

translation: Concerning; with regard to; about; on
explanation: Related to.
japanese: 消費税に関して与野党の意見が対立した。
reading: 消費税に関して 与野党[よやとう]の意見が対立した。
english: With regard to the sales tax, the opinions of the leading party and the opposition parties conflicted.

translation: Concerning; with regard to; about; on
explanation: Related to.
japanese: 人間の言語習得に関してはまだまだ不明のことが多い。
reading: 人間の言語習得に関してはまだまだ不明のことが多い。
english: Concerning human language acquisition, there are still many unknown things.

translation: Concerning; with regard to; about; on
explanation: Related to.
japanese: 先週、東京で超伝導に関する学会が開かれた。
reading: 先週、東京で超<ruby title="伝導(でんどう)"><rb>伝導</rb><rt>でんどう</rt></ruby>に関する学会が開かれた。
english: Last week a conference on superconductivity was held in Tokyo.

translation: Concerning; with regard to; about; on
explanation: Related to.
japanese: その学会で吉岡氏の発表に関して多くの批判がなされた。
reading: その学会で吉岡氏の発表に関して多くの批判がなされた。
english: There was a lot of criticism concerning Mr. Yoshioka's presentation at the conference.

translation: Concerning; with regard to; about; on
explanation: Related to.
japanese: その件に関しましては、まだ発表できる段階ではありません。
reading: その件に関しましては、まだ発表できる<ruby title="段階(だんかい)"><rb>段階</rb><rt>だんかい</rt></ruby>ではありません。
english: With regard to that issue, we are not yet at the stage where we can announce anything.

translation: Concerning; with regard to; about; on
explanation: Related to.
japanese: 最近老人問題に関する記事が目に付く。
reading: 最近老人問題に関する記事が目に付く。
english: We see many articles about problems of the elderly these days.

translation: Concerning; with regard to; about; on
explanation: Related to.
japanese: 大気汚染に関する報告書が委員会に提出された。
reading: 大気汚染に関する報告書が委員会に提出された。
english: A report concerning air pollution was submitted to the committee.

translation: In place of; replacing; on behalf of
explanation: A compound particle to express replacement or substitution of a regular person/thing by someone/something.
japanese: 病気の山田先生に代わって、鈴木先生が教えて下さった。
reading: 病気の山田先生に代わって、鈴木先生が教えて下さった。
english: In place of Professor Yamada, who is ill, Professor Suzuki taught us.

translation: In place of; replacing; on behalf of
explanation: A compound particle to express replacement or substitution of a regular person/thing by someone/something.
japanese: 戦後ガラスに代わってプラスチックが出てきた。
reading: 戦後ガラスに代わってプラスチックが出てきた。
english: After the war plastics became available replacing glass.

translation: In place of; replacing; on behalf of
explanation: A compound particle to express replacement or substitution of a regular person/thing by someone/something.
japanese: レコードに代わってCDが出て、音質がとてもよくなった。
reading: レコードに代わってCDが出て、音質がとてもよくなった。
english: In place of records, CDs have become available, and the sound quality has improved a great deal.

translation: In place of; replacing; on behalf of
explanation: A compound particle to express replacement or substitution of a regular person/thing by someone/something.
japanese: 私が父に代わって、空港までお客さんを迎えに行った。
reading: 私が父に代わって、空港までお客さんを迎えに行った。
english: In place of my father, I went to the airport to pick up our guest.

translation: In place of; replacing; on behalf of
explanation: A compound particle to express replacement or substitution of a regular person/thing by someone/something.
japanese: 御出席の皆様に代わりまして、一言ご挨拶を述べさせていただきます。
reading: 御出席の皆様に代わりまして、一言ご挨拶を述べさせていただきます。
english: On behalf of everyone present here, let me say a word of greeting.

translation: In place of; replacing; on behalf of
explanation: A compound particle to express replacement or substitution of a regular person/thing by someone/something.
japanese: 申し訳ございませんが、社長は今日都合が悪いので、私が社長に代わって参りました。
reading: 申し訳ございませんが、社長は今日都合が悪いので、私が社長に代わって参りました。
english: I am very sorry that the president was unable to attend, but I have come in his place.

translation: Compared with/to; when compared with/to; in comparison to
explanation: If we compare (it) with/to; comparing (it) with.
japanese: 欧米に比べて日本の住宅事情は極めて貧困だ。
reading: 欧米に比べて日本の住宅事情は極めて貧困だ。
english: Compared to (the situations) in Europe and the U.S., the housing situation in Japan is extremely poor.

translation: Compared with/to; when compared with/to; in comparison to
explanation: If we compare (it) with/to; comparing (it) with.
japanese: 日本に来る前に比べると今は大分日本語でものが言えるようになった。
reading: 日本に来る前に比べると今は大分日本語でものが言えるようになった。
english: I have become able to say things in Japanese fairly well compared to my level before I came to Japan.

translation: Compared with/to; when compared with/to; in comparison to
explanation: If we compare (it) with/to; comparing (it) with.
japanese: 今年は去年に比べて雨の日が多いようだ。
reading: 今年は去年に比べて雨の日が多いようだ。
english: In comparison to last year, we seem to have more rainy days this year.

translation: Compared with/to; when compared with/to; in comparison to
explanation: If we compare (it) with/to; comparing (it) with.
japanese: 十年前の暮らしに比べると今の暮らしは天国です。
reading: 十年前の暮らしに比べると今の暮らしは天国です。
english: Compared with our life ten years ago, our present life is heaven.

translation: Compared with/to; when compared with/to; in comparison to
explanation: If we compare (it) with/to; comparing (it) with.
japanese: この新しい（コンピュータ）モデルは、古いモデルと比べて演算が三倍速くなっている。
reading: この新しい（コンピュータ）モデルは、古いモデルと比べて演算が三倍速くなっている。
english: When compared with the older (computer) model, the operation speed of this new model is three times as fast.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 懸命な努力にもかかわらず、健一は大学入試に失敗した。
reading: 懸命[けんめい]な 努力[どりょく]にもかかわらず、健一は大学入試に失敗した。
english: In spite of his strenuous efforts, Ken'ichi failed the college entrance examination.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: あの人はよく運動をする（の）にもかかわらず、太っている。
reading: あの人はよく運動をする（の）にもかかわらず、太っている。
english: He is fat, although he exercises a lot.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 試験が難しかった（の）にもかかわらず、よく出来た。
reading: 試験が難しかった（の）にもかかわらず、よく出来た。
english: Although the exam was hard, I did well.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 冬山は危険なのである（の）にもかかわらず、一郎は山へ出かけた。
reading: 冬山[ふゆやま]は危険なのである（の）にもかかわらず、一郎は山へ出かけた。
english: Although winter mountains are dangerous, Ichiro left for the mountain.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 激しい雨（だった）にもかかわらず、サッカーの試合は続いた。
reading: 激しい雨（だった）にもかかわらず、サッカーの試合は続いた。
english: In spite of the fierce rain, the soccer game continued.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 安い値段（なの・である）にもかかわらず、その家はまだ売れていない。
reading: 安い 値段[ねだん]（なの・である）にもかかわらず、その家はまだ売れていない。
english: Despite the inexpensive price, that house is not sold yet.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 宏は美香を愛していた（の）にもかかわらず、結婚しなかった。
reading: 宏[ひろし]は 美香[みか]を愛していた（の）にもかかわらず、結婚しなかった。
english: In spite of the fact that Hiroshi loved Mika, he didn't marry her.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 昨日は徹夜して勉強した（の）にもかかわらず、試験は出来なかった。
reading: 昨日は 徹夜[てつや]して勉強した（の）にもかかわらず、試験は出来なかった。
english: Although I studied all night last night, I didn't do well on the exam.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: キャロルは日本に三年も住んでいた（の）にもかかわらず、日本語は大変下手だ。
reading: キャロルは日本に三年も住んでいた（の）にもかかわらず、日本語は大変下手だ。
english: Although Carol lived in Japan for three years, her Japanese is very poor.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 日本語経済力は強くなっている（の）にもかかわらず、日本人はそれを実感出来ない。
reading: 日本経済力は強くなっている（の）にもかかわらず、日本人はそれを 実感[じっかん]出来ない。
english: In spite of the fact that the Japanese economy has become strong, the Japanese people cannot feel the effects.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 私のアパートは広い（の）にもかかわらず、家賃が安い。
reading: 私のアパートは広い（の）にもかかわらず、家賃が安い。
english: My apartment is spacious, but the rent is cheap.

translation: Although; though; in spite of; despite; notwithstanding; nevertheless
explanation: Without any relation to a preceding event/situation.
japanese: 旅行が好き（なの・である（の））にもかかわらず、どこに行く暇もない。
reading: 旅行が好き（なの・である（の））にもかかわらず、どこに行く 暇[ひま]もない。
english: I like to travel, but I don't have time to go anywhere.

translation: Based upon
explanation: With something as a basis.
japanese: 事実に基づいてお話しします。
reading: 事実に基づいてお話しします。
english: I will give you the facts. (literally: I will talk on the basis of facts.)

translation: Based upon
explanation: With something as a basis.
japanese: これは五百年前の史料に基づく研究だ。
reading: これは五百年前の史料に基づく研究だ。
english: This is a study based on historical documents from 500 years ago.

translation: Based upon
explanation: With something as a basis.
japanese: この製品はアメリカ製だがすべてJISに基づいて設計されている。
reading: この製品はアメリカ製だがすべてJISに基づいて設計されている。
english: Although this product is made in America, it's designed based entirely on the Japanese Industrial Standard.

translation: Based upon
explanation: With something as a basis.
japanese: このビルはある有名な建築家の設計に基づいて建てられた。
reading: このビルはある有名な建築家の設計に基づいて建てられた。
english: This building was built based on the design of a famous architect.

translation: Based upon
explanation: With something as a basis.
japanese: この報告は去年行われたアンケート調査に基づいて書かれたものである。
reading: この報告は去年行われたアンケート調査に基づいて書かれたものである。
english: This report was (written) based on a survey conducted last year.

translation: Based upon
explanation: With something as a basis.
japanese: 野村氏の講演は氏の二十年間の教育経験に基づく話で、極めて示唆に富むものであった。
reading: 野村氏の講演は氏の二十年間の教育経験に基づく話で、極めて示唆に富むものであった。
english: Mr. Nomura's lecture was based on his 20-year teaching experience (literally: was a talk based on) and was full of suggestions.

translation: Based upon
explanation: With something as a basis.
japanese: これは一つの仮説に基づいた議論です。
reading: これは一つの仮説に基づいた議論です。
english: This is a discussion based on a hypothesis.

translation: When it becomes; when it comes to; when; if
explanation: A phrase that expresses the time when an uncontrollable state or a habitual action occurs.
japanese: 夏になると、摂氏三十度を越す日が多いです。
reading: 夏になると、摂氏三十度を越す日が多いです。
english: In summer (literally: When it becomes summer), there are many days that exceed 30 degrees Celsius.

translation: When it becomes; when it comes to; when; if
explanation: A phrase that expresses the time when an uncontrollable state or a habitual action occurs.
japanese: 父は食べ物のことになると、とてもやかましかった。
reading: 父は食べ物のことになると、とてもやかましかった。
english: When it comes to the matter of food, my father was very particular.

translation: When it becomes; when it comes to; when; if
explanation: A phrase that expresses the time when an uncontrollable state or a habitual action occurs.
japanese: 四月半ばになると、この辺は桜が綺麗に咲きます。
reading: 四月半ばになると、この辺は桜が綺麗に咲きます。
english: In this area, in the middle of April, the cherry trees bloom beautifully.

translation: When it becomes; when it comes to; when; if
explanation: A phrase that expresses the time when an uncontrollable state or a habitual action occurs.
japanese: ニューイングランドと言われるアメリカの東北地方は、秋になると、紅葉がとても綺麗です。
reading: ニューイングランドと言われるアメリカの東北地方は、秋になると、紅葉がとても綺麗です。
english: In the north-east area of the U.S. called New England, tinted autumn leaves are very beautiful.

translation: When it becomes; when it comes to; when; if
explanation: A phrase that expresses the time when an uncontrollable state or a habitual action occurs.
japanese: 私は夜十一時になると、頭が働かなくなる。
reading: 私は夜十一時になると、頭が働かなくなる。
english: At about 11 p.m., my brain stops working.

translation: When it becomes; when it comes to; when; if
explanation: A phrase that expresses the time when an uncontrollable state or a habitual action occurs.
japanese: 子供の頃、夏になると、両親は僕を海に連れて行ってくれた。
reading: 子供の頃、夏になると、両親は僕を海に連れて行ってくれた。
english: When I was a child, in summer, my parents took me to the ocean.

translation: When it becomes; when it comes to; when; if
explanation: A phrase that expresses the time when an uncontrollable state or a habitual action occurs.
japanese: 大学生の時は、休みになると、よく旅行をした。
reading: 大学生の時は、休みになると、よく旅行をした。
english: When I was a college student, I travelled a lot during vacations.

translation: When it becomes; when it comes to; when; if
explanation: A phrase that expresses the time when an uncontrollable state or a habitual action occurs.
japanese: 彼はフットボールの話になると夢中だ。
reading: 彼はフットボールの話になると夢中だ。
english: When the topic of the conversation is football, he is totally absorbed in it.

translation: When it becomes; when it comes to; when; if
explanation: A phrase that expresses the time when an uncontrollable state or a habitual action occurs.
japanese: 社長は娘のことになると、人が変わったように甘くなる。
reading: 社長は娘のことになると、人が変わったように甘くなる。
english: The president becomes lenient as if he were a different person, when it comes to the matter of his daughter.

translation: When it becomes; when it comes to; when; if
explanation: A phrase that expresses the time when an uncontrollable state or a habitual action occurs.
japanese: 雪になると、この空港はよく閉鎖になる。
reading: 雪になると、この空港はよく 閉鎖[へいさ]になる。
english: When it snows, this airport is often closed.

translation: At; on; in; during
explanation: A compound particle which indicates the place of an action/event, a state or time.
japanese: 来年の総会はシカゴのヒルトン・ホテルにおいて行われる。
reading: 来年の総会はシカゴのヒルトン・ホテルにおいて行われる。
english: Next year's general meeting will be held at the Hilton Hotel in Chicago.

translation: At; on; in; during
explanation: A compound particle which indicates the place of an action/event, a state or time.
japanese: コンピュータは近い将来においてほとんどの家庭に行き渡るだろう。
reading: コンピュータは近い将来においてほとんどの家庭に行き渡るだろう。
english: Computers will probably spread to almost every household in the near future.

translation: At; on; in; during
explanation: A compound particle which indicates the place of an action/event, a state or time.
japanese: 先月の東京における環境保護国際会議には全世界から大勢の学者が参加した。
reading: 先月の東京における環境保護国際会議には全世界から大勢の学者が参加した。
english: Many scholars from all over the world took part in last month's international conference in Tokyo on environmental protection.

translation: At; on; in; during
explanation: A compound particle which indicates the place of an action/event, a state or time.
japanese: １９９２年のオリンピックはバルセロナにおいて開催された。
reading: １９９２年のオリンピックはバルセロナにおいて開催された。
english: The 1992 Olympics was held in Barcelona.

translation: At; on; in; during
explanation: A compound particle which indicates the place of an action/event, a state or time.
japanese: 過去においてはこのようなことはあまり問題にならなかった。
reading: 過去においてはこのようなことはあまり問題にならなかった。
english: Such things were hardly considered to be problems in the past.

translation: At; on; in; during
explanation: A compound particle which indicates the place of an action/event, a state or time.
japanese: この作文は文法においてはあまり問題はない。
reading: この作文は文法においてはあまり問題はない。
english: This composition doesn't have many problems in terms of grammar.

translation: At; on; in; during
explanation: A compound particle which indicates the place of an action/event, a state or time.
japanese: 本校における男女学生の比率は二対一である。
reading: 本校における男女学生の比率は二対一である。
english: The ratio of male students to female students at this school is 2 to 1.

translation: At; on; in; during
explanation: A compound particle which indicates the place of an action/event, a state or time.
japanese: 木村博士は遺伝学における権威者として知られている。
reading: 木村博士は遺伝学における権威者として知られている。
english: Dr. Kimura is known as an authority in (the field of) genetics.

translation: At; on; in; during
explanation: A compound particle which indicates the place of an action/event, a state or time.
japanese: 過去五年間における彼の業績は実に素晴らしいものであった。
reading: 過去五年間における彼の業績は実に素晴らしいものであった。
english: His achievements during the past five years were truly remarkable.

translation: At; on; in; during
explanation: A compound particle which indicates the place of an action/event, a state or time.
japanese: 十月十二日における彼のアリバイは成立していない。
reading: 十月十二日における彼のアリバイは成立していない。
english: His alibi on the twelfth of October has not been established.
extra_notes:
【成立】せいりつ ★★★★
coming into existence,arrangements,establishment,conclusion,completion

translation: As, accordingly; in proportion to; in accordance with; following
explanation: Something spontaneously and gradually occurs in accordance with some change.
japanese: 日本の経済力が強くなるに{従って/従い}、日本語学習者が増えてきた。
reading: 日本の経済力が強くなるに{従って/従い}、日本語 学習者[がくしゅうしゃ]が増えてきた。
english: As Japan's economic power has become stronger, Japanese language learners have increased, accordingly.

translation: As, accordingly; in proportion to; in accordance with; following
explanation: Something spontaneously and gradually occurs in accordance with some change.
japanese: 契約に{従って/従い}雇用期間を三年とする。
reading: 契約[けいやく]に{従って/従い} 雇用期間[こようきかん]を三年とする。
english: In accordance with the contract, your tenure shall be three years.

translation: As, accordingly; in proportion to; in accordance with; following
explanation: Something spontaneously and gradually occurs in accordance with some change.
japanese: 収入が増えるに従って、支出も増える。
reading: 収入[しゅうにゅう] が増えるに従って、 支出[ししゅつ]も増える。
english: As our income increases, our expenditure, too, increases.

translation: As, accordingly; in proportion to; in accordance with; following
explanation: Something spontaneously and gradually occurs in accordance with some change.
japanese: 年を取るに従い、体力が衰える。
reading: 年を取るに従い、体力が 衰[おとろ]える。
english: As you grow older, your physical strength declines.

translation: As, accordingly; in proportion to; in accordance with; following
explanation: Something spontaneously and gradually occurs in accordance with some change.
japanese: 文明が進むに従い、人間のストレスが多くなる。
reading: 文明[ぶんめい]が進むに従い、人間のストレスが多くなる。
english: As civilization progresses, human stresses increase.

translation: As, accordingly; in proportion to; in accordance with; following
explanation: Something spontaneously and gradually occurs in accordance with some change.
japanese: 日がたつに従って、父の病気は回復してきた。
reading: 日がたつに従って、父の病気は回復してきた。
english: As the days went by, my father recovered from his illness.

translation: As, accordingly; in proportion to; in accordance with; following
explanation: Something spontaneously and gradually occurs in accordance with some change.
japanese: 太陽が沈んで行くに従って、温度がどんどん下がった。
reading: 太陽が沈んで行くに従って、温度がどんどん下がった。
english: As the sun went down, the temperature went down rapidly.

translation: As, accordingly; in proportion to; in accordance with; following
explanation: Something spontaneously and gradually occurs in accordance with some change.
japanese: 約束に従い、借金を一か月後に返した。
reading: 約束に従い、借金を一か月後に返した。
english: In accordance with the promise I returned the loaned money after a month.

translation: As, accordingly; in proportion to; in accordance with; following
explanation: Something spontaneously and gradually occurs in accordance with some change.
japanese: 社長の命令に従って、彼はただちにマニラに飛んだ。
reading: 社長の命令に従って、彼はただちにマニラに飛んだ。
english: In accordance with the president's order, he flew to Manila immediately.

translation: Nothing more than; not more than; mere; merely; only; just; as little/few as; that's all
explanation: Something or someone is nothing more than what is stated in terms of amount, degree, status, significance, etc.
japanese: これは私の私見に過ぎない。
reading: これは私の私見に過ぎない。
english: This is nothing more than my personal opinion.

translation: Nothing more than; not more than; mere; merely; only; just; as little/few as; that's all
explanation: Something or someone is nothing more than what is stated in terms of amount, degree, status, significance, etc.
japanese: 今期の売り上げの伸びは三パーセントに過ぎない。
reading: 今期の売り上げの伸びは三パーセントに過ぎない。
english: The sales increase this term is as little as three percent.

translation: Nothing more than; not more than; mere; merely; only; just; as little/few as; that's all
explanation: Something or someone is nothing more than what is stated in terms of amount, degree, status, significance, etc.
japanese: あの男は（ただ）言われたことをしている（だけ）に過ぎない。
reading: あの男は（ただ）言われたことをしている（だけ）に過ぎない。
english: That man is not doing more than what he was told to do.

translation: Nothing more than; not more than; mere; merely; only; just; as little/few as; that's all
explanation: Something or someone is nothing more than what is stated in terms of amount, degree, status, significance, etc.
japanese: 彼は私のボーイフレンドの一人に過ぎない。
reading: 彼は私のボーイフレンドの一人に過ぎない。
english: He is nothing more than one of my boyfriends.

translation: Nothing more than; not more than; mere; merely; only; just; as little/few as; that's all
explanation: Something or someone is nothing more than what is stated in terms of amount, degree, status, significance, etc.
japanese: これは数ある中のほんの一例に過ぎない。
reading: これは数ある中のほんの一例に過ぎない。
english: This is only one example among many.

translation: Nothing more than; not more than; mere; merely; only; just; as little/few as; that's all
explanation: Something or someone is nothing more than what is stated in terms of amount, degree, status, significance, etc.
japanese: 今言ったことは私の希望に過ぎませんので、あまり深刻に考えないで下さい。
reading: 今言ったことは私の希望に過ぎませんので、あまり深刻に考えないで下さい。
english: What I've just told you is nothing more than my hope, so please don't take it too seriously.

translation: Nothing more than; not more than; mere; merely; only; just; as little/few as; that's all
explanation: Something or someone is nothing more than what is stated in terms of amount, degree, status, significance, etc.
japanese: 私の収入はアルバイトを入れても年二万ドルに過ぎない。
reading: 私の収入はアルバイトを入れても年二万ドルに過ぎない。
english: My income is only $20,000 even if I include my side job (income).

translation: Nothing more than; not more than; mere; merely; only; just; as little/few as; that's all
explanation: Something or someone is nothing more than what is stated in terms of amount, degree, status, significance, etc.
japanese: 私を支持してくれる人は身内を入れても五十人程度に過ぎない。
reading: 私を支持してくれる人は身内を入れても五十人程度に過ぎない。
english: There are no more than about 50 people who support me (literally: The people who support me are no more than about fifty), even if I include my relatives.

translation: Nothing more than; not more than; mere; merely; only; just; as little/few as; that's all
explanation: Something or someone is nothing more than what is stated in terms of amount, degree, status, significance, etc.
japanese: あの子はまだ十五に過ぎないが、なかなかしっかりしている。
reading: あの子はまだ十五に過ぎないが、なかなかしっかりしている。
english: That girl is only fifteen, but she is quite mature.
extra_notes: しっかり = level headed, reliable, dependable (in addition to 'tightly hanging on')

translation: Nothing more than; not more than; mere; merely; only; just; as little/few as; that's all
explanation: Something or someone is nothing more than what is stated in terms of amount, degree, status, significance, etc.
japanese: 彼は（ただ）人の意見を受け売りしている（だけ）に過ぎない。
reading: 彼は（ただ）人の意見を受け売りしている（だけ）に過ぎない。
english: He is doing nothing more than echoing other people's opinions.

translation: Nothing more than; not more than; mere; merely; only; just; as little/few as; that's all
explanation: Something or someone is nothing more than what is stated in terms of amount, degree, status, significance, etc.
japanese: 彼の演説は（ただ）原稿を読み上げた（だけ）に過ぎない。
reading: 彼の演説は（ただ）原稿を読み上げた（だけ）に過ぎない。
english: His speech was nothing more than the reading of a prepared manuscript.

translation: Nothing more than; not more than; mere; merely; only; just; as little/few as; that's all
explanation: Something or someone is nothing more than what is stated in terms of amount, degree, status, significance, etc.
japanese: 私と山野氏は初対面の時、簡単な挨拶を交わした（だけ）に過ぎない。
reading: 私と山野氏は初対面の時、簡単な挨拶を交わした（だけ）に過ぎない。
english: Mr. Yamano and I did nothing more than exchange simple greetings when we first met each other.

translation: Toward; to; in contrast to; whereas; in regard to; in; per
explanation: Regarding something/someone one opposes, compares, or shows interest in regarding something/someone one opposes, compares or shows interest in.
japanese: これまで日本は外国に対して閉鎖的な政策を取ってきた。
reading: これまで日本は外国に対して閉鎖的な政策を取ってきた。
english: Up until now Japan has taken a closed policy toward foreign countries.

translation: Toward; to; in contrast to; whereas; in regard to; in; per
explanation: Regarding something/someone one opposes, compares, or shows interest in regarding something/someone one opposes, compares or shows interest in.
japanese: 日本の大学は入学するのが難しいのに対して、アメリカの大学は卒業するのが難しい。
reading: 日本の大学は入学するのが難しいのに対して、アメリカの大学は卒業するのが難しい。
english: Japanese colleges are hard to enter; whereas American colleges are hard to graduate from.

translation: Toward; to; in contrast to; whereas; in regard to; in; per
explanation: Regarding something/someone one opposes, compares, or shows interest in regarding something/someone one opposes, compares or shows interest in.
japanese: アメリカでは離婚に{対する/対しての}考え方が大分変わってきた。
reading: アメリカでは離婚に{対する/対しての}考え方が大分変わってきた。
english: In America, attitudes toward divorce have greatly changed.

translation: Toward; to; in contrast to; whereas; in regard to; in; per
explanation: Regarding something/someone one opposes, compares, or shows interest in regarding something/someone one opposes, compares or shows interest in.
japanese: 鈴木さんは誰に対しても丁寧だ。
reading: 鈴木さんは誰に対しても丁寧だ。
english: Mr. Suzuki is polite towards everybody.

translation: Toward; to; in contrast to; whereas; in regard to; in; per
explanation: Regarding something/someone one opposes, compares, or shows interest in regarding something/someone one opposes, compares or shows interest in.
japanese: 日本は外国に対して市場をもっと開放すべきた。
reading: 日本は外国に対して市場をもっと開放すべきた。
english: Japan should open its market more widely towards foreign countries.

translation: Toward; to; in contrast to; whereas; in regard to; in; per
explanation: Regarding something/someone one opposes, compares, or shows interest in regarding something/someone one opposes, compares or shows interest in.
japanese: 私は政治に対して強い関心がある。
reading: 私は政治に対して強い関心がある。
english: I have a strong interest in politics.

translation: Toward; to; in contrast to; whereas; in regard to; in; per
explanation: Regarding something/someone one opposes, compares, or shows interest in regarding something/someone one opposes, compares or shows interest in.
japanese: 市民は増税に対して強く反対している。
reading: 市民は増税に対して強く反対している。
english: The citizens are strongly opposed to the tax hike.

translation: Toward; to; in contrast to; whereas; in regard to; in; per
explanation: Regarding something/someone one opposes, compares, or shows interest in regarding something/someone one opposes, compares or shows interest in.
japanese: 私は高校生の時から、日本の文化に対して興味があった。
reading: 私は高校生の時から、日本の文化に対して興味があった。
english: Since my high school days, I have had an interest in Japanese culture.

translation: Toward; to; in contrast to; whereas; in regard to; in; per
explanation: Regarding something/someone one opposes, compares, or shows interest in regarding something/someone one opposes, compares or shows interest in.
japanese: 去年は自動車事故が少なかったのに対して、今年は大変多かった。
reading: 去年は自動車事故が少なかったのに対して、今年は大変多かった。
english: Last year there were very few car accidents, whereas this year the number was very high.

translation: Toward; to; in contrast to; whereas; in regard to; in; per
explanation: Regarding something/someone one opposes, compares, or shows interest in regarding something/someone one opposes, compares or shows interest in.
japanese: 日本人は褒められた時、よく「とんでもない」と言う。これに対して、アメリカ人はよく「ありがとう」と言う。
reading: 日本人は褒められた時、よく「とんでもない」と言う。これに対して、アメリカ人はよく「ありがとう」と言う。
english: When Japanese get compliments, they often say "Oh, not at all." In contrast to this, Americans often say "Thank you."

translation: Toward; to; in contrast to; whereas; in regard to; in; per
explanation: Regarding something/someone one opposes, compares, or shows interest in regarding something/someone one opposes, compares or shows interest in.
japanese: 女性の地位は日本ではまだ低いのに対して、欧米では比較的高い。
reading: 女性の地位は日本ではまだ低いのに対して、欧米では比較的高い。
english: Women's position is still low in Japan, whereas in Europe and America it is relatively high.

translation: Toward; to; in contrast to; whereas; in regard to; in; per
explanation: Regarding something/someone one opposes, compares, or shows interest in regarding something/someone one opposes, compares or shows interest in.
japanese: 東ヨーロッパの国々が民主化に向かっているのに対して、中国大陸と北朝鮮は民主化がまだ遅れているようだ。
reading: 東ヨーロッパの国々が民主化に向かっているのに対して、中国大陸と北朝鮮は民主化がまだ遅れているようだ。
english: Eastern European countries are progressing towards democratization, whereas continental China and North Korea appear to be slower in democratization.

translation: Toward; to; in contrast to; whereas; in regard to; in; per
explanation: Regarding something/someone one opposes, compares, or shows interest in regarding something/someone one opposes, compares or shows interest in.
japanese: ロシアに対してのアメリカ人の見方は最近友好的になった。
reading: ロシアに対してのアメリカ人の見方は最近友好的になった。
english: American views of Russia have recently become friendlier.

translation: Toward; to; in contrast to; whereas; in regard to; in; per
explanation: Regarding something/someone one opposes, compares, or shows interest in regarding something/someone one opposes, compares or shows interest in.
japanese: 部長は岡田に対して有利な発言をした。
reading: 部長は 岡田[おかだ]に対して有利な発言をした。
english: The departmental chief made a remark in Okada's favour.

translation: Toward; to; in contrast to; whereas; in regard to; in; per
explanation: Regarding something/someone one opposes, compares, or shows interest in regarding something/someone one opposes, compares or shows interest in.
japanese: その経済学者の説に{対する・対して}反論はなかった。
reading: その経済学者の説に{対する・対して}反論はなかった。
english: There wasn't a counterargument against the economist's thesis.

translation: To; for
explanation: From the standpoint of; so far as someone (or something) is concerned.
japanese: これは我々にとって無視出来ない問題だ。
reading: これは我々にとって無視出来ない問題だ。
english: This is a problem that we cannot ignore.

translation: To; for
explanation: From the standpoint of; so far as someone (or something) is concerned.
japanese: この大学で教えられることは私にとって極めて名誉なことです。
reading: この大学で教えられることは私にとって極めて 名誉[めいよ]なことです。
english: Being able to teach at this university is a big honour for me.

translation: To; for
explanation: From the standpoint of; so far as someone (or something) is concerned.
japanese: 町の人々にとってこの工場の閉鎖は死活問題だ。
reading: 町の人々にとってこの 工場[こうじょう]の 閉鎖[へいさ]は 死活問題[しかつもんだい]だ。
english: For people in this town, the shutdown of this plant is a matter of life and death.

translation: To; for
explanation: From the standpoint of; so far as someone (or something) is concerned.
japanese: 今日は私達にとって忘れられない日になるでしょう。
reading: 今日は私達にとって忘れられない日になるでしょう。
english: Today will be an unforgettable day for us.

translation: To; for
explanation: From the standpoint of; so far as someone (or something) is concerned.
japanese: 今度のアメリカの輸入政策は日本企業にとって大きな打撃になる。
reading: 今度のアメリカの 輸入[ゆにゅう] 政策[せいさく]は日本 企業[きぎょう]にとって大きな 打撃[だげき]になる。
english: America's policy on imports this time will be a big blow to Japanese companies.

translation: To; for
explanation: From the standpoint of; so far as someone (or something) is concerned.
japanese: 今回の合併は我が社にとってあまり益はない。
reading: 今回の 合併[がっぺい]は 我[わ]が 社[しゃ]にとってあまり 益[えき]はない。
english: There is little benefit for our company in this merger.

translation: To; for
explanation: From the standpoint of; so far as someone (or something) is concerned.
japanese: ここは君にとって一番安全な場所だ。
reading: ここは君にとって一番安全な場所だ。
english: This is the safest place for you.

translation: To; for
explanation: From the standpoint of; so far as someone (or something) is concerned.
japanese: 今村さんは私にとって遠い親戚に当たる。
reading: 今村さんは私にとって遠い 親戚[しんせき]に当たる。
english: Mr. Imamura is a remote relative of mine.

translation: About; on; concerning; regarding; with regard to; of
explanation: Concerning something/someone.
japanese: 私は日本の政治制度について研究しています。
reading: 私は日本の 政治制度[せいじせいど]について研究しています。
english: I am doing research on the Japanese political system.

translation: About; on; concerning; regarding; with regard to; of
explanation: Concerning something/someone.
japanese: スミスさんは日本へ留学することについて色々私に尋ねた。
reading: スミスさんは日本へ留学することについて色々私に尋ねた。
english: Mr. Smith asked me various questions about his going to Japan for study.

translation: About; on; concerning; regarding; with regard to; of
explanation: Concerning something/someone.
japanese: 御家族について話して下さい。
reading: 御家族について話して下さい。
english: Please talk about your family.

translation: About; on; concerning; regarding; with regard to; of
explanation: Concerning something/someone.
japanese: 何について調べているんですか。
reading: 何について調べているんですか。
english: What are you investigating?

translation: About; on; concerning; regarding; with regard to; of
explanation: Concerning something/someone.
japanese: 毎日の生活について聞いてもいいですか。
reading: 毎日の生活について聞いてもいいですか。
english: May I ask you about your daily life?

translation: About; on; concerning; regarding; with regard to; of
explanation: Concerning something/someone.
japanese: 日本に来る前に、日本についてどんなイメージを持っていらっしゃいましたか。
reading: 日本に来る前に、日本についてどんなイメージを持っていらっしゃいましたか。
english: What kind of images did you have of Japan before you came to Japan?

translation: About; on; concerning; regarding; with regard to; of
explanation: Concerning something/someone.
japanese: 先生は自分の国について作文を書くようにおっしゃりました。
reading: 先生は自分の国について作文を書くようにおっしゃりました。
english: Our teacher told us to write a composition on our own country.

translation: About; on; concerning; regarding; with regard to; of
explanation: Concerning something/someone.
japanese: 私はアメリカ人と結婚することについて両親と相談した。
reading: 私はアメリカ人と結婚することについて両親と相談した。
english: I talked with my parents regarding my getting married to an American.

translation: About; on; concerning; regarding; with regard to; of
explanation: Concerning something/someone.
japanese: 日本人の宗教についての考え方は西洋人のとはかなり違う。
reading: 日本人の 宗教[しゅうきょう]についての考え方は 西洋人[せいようじん]のとはかなり違う。
english: Japanese views on religion are quite different from those of Westerners.

translation: About; on; concerning; regarding; with regard to; of
explanation: Concerning something/someone.
japanese: 課長は私が会議に出なかったことについて何か言っていましたか。
reading: 課長は私が会議に出なかったことについて何か言っていましたか。
english: Did the section chief say anything about my absence from the meeting?

translation: About; on; concerning; regarding; with regard to; of
explanation: Concerning something/someone.
japanese: 新聞社が外国人雇用問題についての意見を求めてきた。
reading: 新聞社が外国人 雇用[こよう]問題についての意見を 求[もと]めてきた。
english: The newspaper company asked about my views on the problem of hiring foreigners.

translation: About; on; concerning; regarding; with regard to; of
explanation: Concerning something/someone.
japanese: 日本が軍隊を平和維持のために海外に派遣することについての是非が盛んに討議された。
reading: 日本が 軍隊[ぐんたい]を 平和維持[へいわいじ]のために海外に 派遣[はけん]することについての是非が 盛[さか]んに 討議[とうぎ]された。
english: There have been heated discussions as to whether it is right or wrong for Japan to send its army abroad for peacekeeping purposes.

translation: A; per; for; on; to
explanation: A compound particle which expresses a rate or ratio.
japanese: この仕事は一時間につき六ドル貰える。
reading: この仕事は一時間につき六ドル貰える。
english: This job will pay you six dollars an hour. (literally: You can get six dollars an hour doing this job.)

translation: A; per; for; on; to
explanation: A compound particle which expresses a rate or ratio.
japanese: 一冊につき百五十円の送料が要ります。
reading: 一冊につき百五十円の送料が<ruby title="要(い)"><rb>要</rb><rt>い</rt></ruby>ります。
english: Postage of one hundred and fifty yen is necessary per copy.

translation: A; per; for; on; to
explanation: A compound particle which expresses a rate or ratio.
japanese: 米一カップにつき、しょう油大さじ二杯の割合にします。
reading: 米一カップにつき、しょう油大さじ二杯の割合にします。
english: The ratio should be two tablespoons of soy sauce to a cup of rice.

translation: A; per; for; on; to
explanation: A compound particle which expresses a rate or ratio.
japanese: 切符は一人につき三枚までにして下さい
reading: 切符は一人につき三枚までにして下さい。
english: Please limit it to three tickets per person.

translation: A; per; for; on; to
explanation: A compound particle which expresses a rate or ratio.
japanese: 間違い一つにつき一点減点します。
reading: 間違い一つにつき一点減点します。
english: I'll take one point off for each mistake.

translation: As; in proportion to; with
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that a change occurs in accordance with another simultaneous change.
japanese: 日本語が上達するにつれて日本人の友達が増えた。
reading: 日本語が上達するにつれて日本人の友達が増えた。
english: As my Japanese became more proficient, the number of my Japanese friends increased.

translation: As; in proportion to; with
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that a change occurs in accordance with another simultaneous change.
japanese: 時代の変化につれて、文化も変わっていく。
reading: 時代の変化につれて、文化も変わっていく。
english: Culture also changes with the change of the times.

translation: As; in proportion to; with
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that a change occurs in accordance with another simultaneous change.
japanese: 病気が治ってくるにつれて、食欲が出てきた。
reading: 病気が治ってくるにつれて、食欲が出てきた。
english: As I recovered from my illness, I regained my appetite.

translation: As; in proportion to; with
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that a change occurs in accordance with another simultaneous change.
japanese: 年を取るにつれて、体力がなくなる。
reading: 年を取るにつれて、体力がなくなる。
english: As people grow older, they lose their physical strength.

translation: As; in proportion to; with
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that a change occurs in accordance with another simultaneous change.
japanese: 日本の生活が長くなるにつれて、日本のよさ、悪さがよく分かってきた。
reading: 日本の生活が長くなるにつれて、日本のよさ、悪さがよく分かってきた。
english: As I've spent more time in Japan, I have come to understand the good and bad parts of Japan better.

translation: As; in proportion to; with
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that a change occurs in accordance with another simultaneous change.
japanese: 日本の経済力が伸びるにつれて、日本語の学生が増えてきた。
reading: 日本の経済力が伸びるにつれて、日本語の学生が増えてきた。
english: As Japan's economic strength has grown, Japanese language students have increased.

translation: As; in proportion to; with
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that a change occurs in accordance with another simultaneous change.
japanese: 秋が深くなるにつれて、紅葉が綺麗になってきた。
reading: 秋が深くなるにつれて、紅葉が綺麗になってきた。
english: As we've moved further into autumn, the coloured leaves have become more beautiful.

translation: As; in proportion to; with
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that a change occurs in accordance with another simultaneous change.
japanese: 子供は成長するにつれて、親から離れていく。
reading: 子供は成長するにつれて、親から離れていく。
english: As children grow up, they become independent of their parents.

translation: As; in proportion to; with
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that a change occurs in accordance with another simultaneous change.
japanese: 季節の変化につれて、風景も変わる。
reading: 季節の変化につれて、 風景[ふうけい]も変わる。
english: The scenery also changes with season changes.

translation: As; in proportion to; with
explanation: A phrase used to indicate that a change occurs in accordance with another simultaneous change.
japanese: 産業の発展につれて、公害も増えていく。
reading: 産業の発展につれて、公害も増えていく。
english: With industrial development, pollution also increases.

translation: To; in order to; for; for the purpose of ~
explanation: A conjunction/compound particle to indicate a purpose for doing something.
japanese: 豊かな生活を送るには健康が第一だ。
reading: 豊かな生活を送るには健康が第一だ。
english: In order to lead a rich life, health should be your primary concern.

translation: To; in order to; for; for the purpose of ~
explanation: A conjunction/compound particle to indicate a purpose for doing something.
japanese: ハイヒールはハイキングには不向きだ。
reading: ハイヒールはハイキングには不向きだ。
english: High-heeled shoes are unsuitable for hiking.

translation: To; in order to; for; for the purpose of ~
explanation: A conjunction/compound particle to indicate a purpose for doing something.
japanese: 日本を知るには日本語を学ぶのが一番だ。
reading: 日本を知るには日本語を学ぶのが一番だ。
english: The best course for getting to know Japan is to study the Japanese language.

translation: To; in order to; for; for the purpose of ~
explanation: A conjunction/compound particle to indicate a purpose for doing something.
japanese: 人生を豊かにするには趣味を沢山持つことが大事だ。
reading: 人生を豊かにするには趣味を沢山持つことが大事だ。
english: To enrich your life it is important is to have many hobbies.

translation: To; in order to; for; for the purpose of ~
explanation: A conjunction/compound particle to indicate a purpose for doing something.
japanese: 人の性格を見抜くには深い洞察力が必要だ。
reading: 人の性格を見抜くには深い洞察力が必要だ。
english: In order to see through a person's personality, one needs to have deep insight.

translation: To; in order to; for; for the purpose of ~
explanation: A conjunction/compound particle to indicate a purpose for doing something.
japanese: 外国語の能力を伸ばすにはその国に行くのが一番だろう。
reading: 外国語の能力を伸ばすにはその国に行くのが一番だろう。
english: The best way for developing one's proficiency in a foreign language would be to go to the country of that language.

translation: To; in order to; for; for the purpose of ~
explanation: A conjunction/compound particle to indicate a purpose for doing something.
japanese: 世界の平和を維持するにはエリートの交流より庶民のレベルの交流が肝心だ。
reading: 世界の平和を維持するにはエリートの交流より庶民のレベルの交流が 肝心[かんじん]だ。
english: To maintain world peace, exchange among the general public rather than exchange among elites is essential.

translation: To; in order to; for; for the purpose of ~
explanation: A conjunction/compound particle to indicate a purpose for doing something.
japanese: 期末レポートを書くにはワープロが欠かせない。
reading: 期末レポートを書くにはワープロが欠かせない。
english: A word processor is a must for writing a term paper.

translation: To; in order to; for; for the purpose of ~
explanation: A conjunction/compound particle to indicate a purpose for doing something.
japanese: あの人を説得するには時間がかかる。
reading: あの人を説得するには時間がかかる。
english: It takes time to persuade him.

translation: To; in order to; for; for the purpose of ~
explanation: A conjunction/compound particle to indicate a purpose for doing something.
japanese: このクラブの会員になるには会員の推薦状が必要だった。
reading: このクラブの会員になるには会員の推薦状が必要だった。
english: In order to become a member of this club a member's letter of recommendation was necessary.

translation: To; in order to; for; for the purpose of ~
explanation: A conjunction/compound particle to indicate a purpose for doing something.
japanese: この鞄は長旅には便利だ。
reading: この鞄は長旅には便利だ。
english: This bag is suitable for a long travel.

translation: To; in order to; for; for the purpose of ~
explanation: A conjunction/compound particle to indicate a purpose for doing something.
japanese: この研究にはかなりの時間とお金がかかる。
reading: この研究にはかなりの時間とお金がかかる。
english: This research needs a considerable amount of time and money.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: 漢和辞典によって知らない漢字を調べる。
reading: 漢和[かんわ]辞典によって知らない漢字を調べる。
english: We examine unknown kanji with a Chinese character dictionary.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: 先生によって、勿論、教え方が違います。
reading: 先生によって、勿論、教え方が違います。
english: Teaching methods are, of course, different, depending on the teacher.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: 戦争によって父を亡くした。
reading: 戦争によって父を亡くした。
english: We lost our father, owing to the war.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: この研究所は文部省によって設立された。
reading: この研究所は文部省によって設立された。
english: This research institute was established by the Ministry of Education.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: 奨学金がもらえるかどうかによって大学入学を決めます。
reading: 奨学金がもらえるかどうかによって大学入学を決めます。
english: I will decide my entrance to college depending on whether I can get a scholarship or not.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: 何を食べるかによって健康状態は変わる。
reading: 何を食べるかによって健康状態は変わる。
english: Our health condition changes according to what we eat.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: 我々は本を読むことによって視野を広げることが出来る。
reading: 我々は本を読むことによって視野を広げることが出来る。
english: We can expand our horizons by reading books.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: この頃は宇宙中継によって世界のニュースをテレビで見ることが出来る。
reading: この頃は宇宙中継によって世界のニュースをテレビで見ることが出来る。
english: These days we can watch world news on TV via satellite live broadcasting.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: その老人達はわずかの貯金によって生活している。
reading: その老人達はわずかの貯金によって生活している。
english: The old people are living on little savings.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: その問題は話し合いによって解決出来るはずだ。
reading: その問題は話し合いによって解決出来るはずだ。
english: We should be able to solve that problem by means of negotiation.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: 人によって、年のとり方が違う。
reading: 人によって、年のとり方が違う。
english: Depending on the person, the aging process differs.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: 僕はその日の気分によって、違う音楽を聞きます。
reading: 僕はその日の気分によって、違う音楽を聞きます。
english: Depending on the day's mood, I listen to different music.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: 定年は会社によって違う。
reading: 定年は会社によって違う。
english: Retirement ages vary from company to company.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: その青年は麻薬によって青春時代を失ってしまった。
reading: その青年は麻薬によって青春時代を失ってしまった。
english: The young man lost his adolescence because of drugs.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: 彼は難病によって再起不能になった。
reading: 彼は難病によって 再起不能[さいきふのう]になった。
english: He became past the point of recovery because of the incurable disease.

translation: According to; due to; owing to; because of; depending on; from ~ to; by means of; on the basis of; with; by
explanation: A particle that indicates means, cause, agent of passive sentence, or dependency on a situation.
japanese: この絵はピカソによって描かれた。
reading: この絵はピカソによって描かれた。
english: This picture was painted by Picasso.

translation: Because of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something takes place or does not take place because of something.
japanese: ホールさんは今仕事の関係で東京に行っています。
reading: ホールさんは今仕事の関係で東京に行っています。
english: Mr. Hall has gone to Tokyo on a business-related matter.

translation: Because of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something takes place or does not take place because of something.
japanese: 鈴木は単位の関係で今年は卒業出来ないそうだ。
reading: 鈴木は単位の関係で今年は卒業出来ないそうだ。
english: I heard that Suzuki cannot graduate this year because of insufficient credits / units.

translation: Because of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something takes place or does not take place because of something.
japanese: 時間の関係で、残念ですが、詳しくお話し出来ません。
reading: 時間の関係で、残念ですが、詳しくお話し出来ません。
english: Because of the time limit, I am sorry I cannot go into detail.

translation: Because of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something takes place or does not take place because of something.
japanese: 部屋の広さの関係で、四十人以上はお呼び出来ません。
reading: 部屋の広さの関係で、四十人以上はお呼び出来ません。
english: Because of the size of the room we cannot invite more than 40 people.

translation: Because of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something takes place or does not take place because of something.
japanese: 桃子は年齢の関係で、採用されなかったようだ。
reading: 桃子は年齢の関係で、採用されなかったようだ。
english: It seems that Momoko was not hired because of her age.

translation: Because of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something takes place or does not take place because of something.
japanese: レズリーは会社の関係でよく海外に出張するらしい。
reading: レズリーは会社の関係でよく海外に出張するらしい。
english: I was told that Leslie makes frequent company-related business trips abroad (literally: makes frequent trips abroad because of his company).

translation: Because of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something takes place or does not take place because of something.
japanese: みゆきは御主人の仕事の関係でロンドンに三年住むそうだ。
reading: みゆきは御主人の仕事の関係でロンドンに三年住むそうだ。
english: I heard that because of her husband's work Miyuki is going to live in London for 3 years.

translation: Because of
explanation: A phrase indicating that something takes place or does not take place because of something.
japanese: 予算の関係で、そのプロジェクトは中止になった。
reading: 予算の関係で、そのプロジェクトは中止になった。
english: Because of the budgetary situation, the project has been discontinued.
extra_notes: chuushi can also mean suspended, so don't mark wrong if you translate it this way

translation: About; in terms of; related to
explanation: Things of/about.
japanese: 私は明日の講義で日本文化のことを話すつもりだ。
reading: 私は明日の講義で日本文化のことを話すつもりだ。
english: I'm going to talk about Japanese culture in my lecture tomorrow.

translation: About; in terms of; related to
explanation: Things of/about.
japanese: 彼女のことはもう忘れた方がいいよ。
reading: 彼女のことはもう忘れた方がいいよ。
english: You'd better forget about her now.

translation: About; in terms of; related to
explanation: Things of/about.
japanese: 日本留学のことでちょっとご相談があるんですが。
reading: 日本留学のことでちょっとご相談があるんですが。
english: I'd like to talk to you about studying in Japan.

translation: About; in terms of; related to
explanation: Things of/about.
japanese: 実は、明日の会議のことなんですが。
reading: 実は、明日の会議のことなんですが。
english: Actually, about tomorrow's meeting...

translation: About; in terms of; related to
explanation: Things of/about.
japanese: 昨日荒井さんが君のことを色々聞いていたよ。
reading: 昨日荒井さんが君のことを色々聞いていたよ。
english: Miss Arai asked various questions about you yesterday.

translation: About; in terms of; related to
explanation: Things of/about.
japanese: レポートは日本の大学生活のことを書こうと思っている。
reading: レポートは日本の大学生活のことを書こうと思っている。
english: For my term paper I'm thinking of writing about college life in Japan.

translation: About; in terms of; related to
explanation: Things of/about.
japanese: 子供のことは私が責任を持ちます。
reading: 子供のことは私が責任を持ちます。
english: I'll take the responsibility for our children (literally: for things related to our children).

translation: About; in terms of; related to
explanation: Things of/about.
japanese: あのう、お電話したのは、来週のパーティーのことなんですが。
reading: あのう、お電話したのは、来週のパーティーのことなんですが。
english: (The reason) I'm calling (literally: I've called) (is to talk) about the party next week.

translation: Because ~ is habitually/usually/often that way; because
explanation: Because it is a matter of X with which/whom something is habitually the case.
japanese: 中島のことだから、今日もまた遅れて来るだろう。
reading: 中島のことだから、今日もまた遅れて来るだろう。
english: Because Nakajima is always that way (i.e., comes late), he will probably come late again today. (literally: Because it is a matter of Nakajima (who habitually comes late)).

translation: Because ~ is habitually/usually/often that way; because
explanation: Because it is a matter of X with which/whom something is habitually the case.
japanese: 傷みやすい豆腐のことだから、冷蔵庫に入れておいた方がいいですよ。
reading: 傷みやすい豆腐のことだから、冷蔵庫に入れておいた方がいいですよ。
english: Because tofu goes bad quickly, you'd better put it in the refrigerator. (literally: Because it is a matter of tofu, which always goes bad quickly . . .)

translation: Because ~ is habitually/usually/often that way; because
explanation: Because it is a matter of X with which/whom something is habitually the case.
japanese: 夏のことだから、食べ物には十分気を付けて下さい。
reading: 夏のことだから、食べ物には十分気を付けて下さい。
english: Because it is summer (when foods go bad quickly), please be very careful about what you eat.

translation: Because ~ is habitually/usually/often that way; because
explanation: Because it is a matter of X with which/whom something is habitually the case.
japanese: お金持ちの日本人のことだから、きっと高くても買いますよ。
reading: お金持ちの日本人のことだから、きっと高くても買いますよ。
english: Because they are rich Japanese, I'm sure they will buy them even if they are expensive.

translation: Because ~ is habitually/usually/often that way; because
explanation: Because it is a matter of X with which/whom something is habitually the case.
japanese: カラオケの好きな木下さんのことがから、歌い始めたらマイクを離さないんじゃありませんか。
reading: カラオケの好きな 木下[きのした]さんのことだから、歌い始めたらマイクを離さないんじゃありませんか。
english: Because Kinoshita loves karaoke, I have a feeling that he will not let go of the microphone once he starts singing.

translation: Because ~ is habitually/usually/often that way; because
explanation: Because it is a matter of X with which/whom something is habitually the case.
japanese: 酒好きの山田のことだから、この酒を見たら飲まずには帰らないだろう。
reading: 酒好きの山田のことだから、この酒を見たら飲まずには帰らないだろう。
english: Because Yamada is a sake lover, if he sees this sake, he will probably not leave until he drinks it (literally: without drinking it).

translation: Only; just; alone
explanation: A particle which expresses a limit imposed upon an action, event, or a state.
japanese: 要点のみ（を）話して下さい。
reading: 要点のみ（を）話して下さい。
english: Please tell me just the main point.

translation: Only; just; alone
explanation: A particle which expresses a limit imposed upon an action, event, or a state.
japanese: これは吉田先生にのみ話してあります。
reading: これは吉田先生にのみ話してあります。
english: I have told this only to Professor Yoshida.

translation: Only; just; alone
explanation: A particle which expresses a limit imposed upon an action, event, or a state.
japanese: 勝てるかどうか分からないが、ベストを尽くすのみだ。
reading: 勝てるかどうか分からないが、ベストを尽くすのみだ。
english: I don't know whether I can win or not, but I will just do my best.

translation: Only; just; alone
explanation: A particle which expresses a limit imposed upon an action, event, or a state.
japanese: この答えは私のみ（が）知っている。
reading: この答えは私のみ（が）知っている。
english: Only I know the answer to this.

translation: Only; just; alone
explanation: A particle which expresses a limit imposed upon an action, event, or a state.
japanese: 姓のみ記入のこと。
reading: 姓のみ記入のこと。
english: Write your surname only.

translation: Only; just; alone
explanation: A particle which expresses a limit imposed upon an action, event, or a state.
japanese: 私はただ言われたことをするのみだ。
reading: 私はただ言われたことをするのみだ。
english: I will just do what I was told to do.

translation: Only; just; alone
explanation: A particle which expresses a limit imposed upon an action, event, or a state.
japanese: 外装が終わったのみでまだほかは何も手が着いていない。
reading: 外装が終わったのみでまだほかは何も手が着いていない。
english: We've just finished the exterior and haven't started anything else yet.

translation: Under; in; with
explanation: Under some object; under the control or influence of someone or something.
japanese: 私は鈴木先生の指導の下で修士論文を書き上げた。
reading: 私は鈴木先生の指導の下で修士論文を書き上げた。
english: I finished my master's thesis under Professor Suzuki's guidance.

translation: Under; in; with
explanation: Under some object; under the control or influence of someone or something.
japanese: さんさんたる太陽の下で開会式が行われた。
reading: さんさんたる太陽の下で開会式が行われた。
english: The opening ceremony was held under the brilliant sun.

translation: Under; in; with
explanation: Under some object; under the control or influence of someone or something.
japanese: 弁護士（の）立ち会いの下で私達の離婚が成立した。
reading: 弁護士（の）立ち会いの下で私達の離婚が成立した。
english: Our divorce was agreed upon in (literally: under) the presence of attorneys.

translation: Under; in; with
explanation: Under some object; under the control or influence of someone or something.
japanese: 囚人達は厳しい監視の下で強制労働をさせられた。
reading: 囚人達は厳しい監視の下で強制労働をさせられた。
english: The prisoners were forced to work under strict supervision.

translation: Under; in; with
explanation: Under some object; under the control or influence of someone or something.
japanese: このインフレの下では金を貯めても意味がない。
reading: このインフレの下では金を貯めても意味がない。
english: With this inflation there's no point in saving money.

translation: As far as ~ is concerned; as far as ~ goes; from the viewpoint/standpoint of; according to; in terms of
explanation: As far as ~ is concerned.
japanese: この計画は書類の上では問題なさそうだ。
reading: この計画は書類の上では問題なさそうだ。
english: There seems to be no problem with this plan as far as the documents are concerned.

translation: As far as ~ is concerned; as far as ~ goes; from the viewpoint/standpoint of; according to; in terms of
explanation: As far as ~ is concerned.
japanese: 計算の上では二百万円ぐらい儲かることになっている。
reading: 計算の上では二百万円ぐらい儲かることになっている。
english: According to the calculations, we are supposed to make a profit of (about) two million yen.

translation: As far as ~ is concerned; as far as ~ goes; from the viewpoint/standpoint of; according to; in terms of
explanation: As far as ~ is concerned.
japanese: このプロジェクトは話しの上ではうまく行きそうだが、何となく不安だ。
reading: このプロジェクトは話しの上ではうまく行きそうだが、何となく不安だ。
english: Although in theory (literally: As far as the story is concerned,) it looks like this project will work out, I feel somewhat uneasy

translation: As far as ~ is concerned; as far as ~ goes; from the viewpoint/standpoint of; according to; in terms of
explanation: As far as ~ is concerned.
japanese: 数字の上では川野の方が倉田より強そうだ。
reading: 数字の上では川野の方が 倉田[くらた]より強そうだ。
english: Statistically, (literally: As far as the figures are concerned,) Kawano looks stronger than Kurata.

translation: As far as ~ is concerned; as far as ~ goes; from the viewpoint/standpoint of; according to; in terms of
explanation: As far as ~ is concerned.
japanese: 大野は仕事の上では完全主義者だが、私生活はだらしがない。
reading: 大野は仕事の上では完全主義者だが、私生活はだらしがない。
english: Ohno is a perfectionist at work (literally: as far as his business is concerned) but messy in his private life.

translation: It will be/was ~ when/that ~
explanation: A structure which focuses on a time when something takes place.
japanese: 吉田さんと最後に会ったのは１９８５年の五月のことだ。
reading: 吉田さんと最後に会ったのは１９８５年の五月のことだ。
english: It was in May 1985 that I last met Mr. Yoshida.

translation: It will be/was ~ when/that ~
explanation: A structure which focuses on a time when something takes place.
japanese: 日本語の面白さが分かり始めたのはごく最近のことだ。
reading: 日本語の面白さが分かり始めたのはごく最近のことだ。
english: It was only recently that I began to understand how interesting Japanese is.

translation: It will be/was ~ when/that ~
explanation: A structure which focuses on a time when something takes place.
japanese: 本格的なロボットが現れたのは１９６０年代後半のことである。
reading: 本格的なロボットが現れたのは１９６０年代後半のことである。
english: It was in the late sixties when genuine robots came out.

translation: It will be/was ~ when/that ~
explanation: A structure which focuses on a time when something takes place.
japanese: 父が公務員だったのは私がまだ学校へ行く前のことだ。
reading: 父が公務員だったのは私がまだ学校へ行く前のことだ。
english: It was before I went to school that my father was a government worker.

translation: It will be/was ~ when/that ~
explanation: A structure which focuses on a time when something takes place.
japanese: 日本製品の評判が悪かったのは戦後二十年くらいの間のことだ。
reading: 日本製品の評判が悪かったのは戦後二十年くらいの間のことだ。
english: It was for a period of about twenty years after World War II that the reputation of Japanese products was bad.

translation: It will be/was ~ when/that ~
explanation: A structure which focuses on a time when something takes place.
japanese: 健一と利子が仲良く歩いているところを見たのはつい一か月ほど前のことなのに彼らはもう別れたという話だ。
reading: 健一と 利子[としこ]が仲良く歩いているところを見たのはつい一か月ほど前のことなのに彼らはもう別れたという話だ。
english: Although it was only about a month ago when I saw Ken'ichi and Toshiko walking together intimately, I heard they've already split up.

translation: Not
explanation: An archaic auxiliary that indicates negation.
japanese: グローバルな時代に自国のことだけを考えるわけにはいかぬ。
reading: グローバルな時代に自国のことだけを考えるわけにはいかぬ。
english: In the global age we cannot think of our own country alone.

translation: Not
explanation: An archaic auxiliary that indicates negation.
japanese: 知らぬことを知らぬと言うには勇気が要る。
reading: 知らぬことを知らぬと言うには勇気が要る。
english: When you don't know something, it takes courage to admit it.

translation: Not
explanation: An archaic auxiliary that indicates negation.
japanese: 彼は何を聞いても、知らぬとしか答えぬ。
reading: 彼は何を聞いても、知らぬとしか答えぬ。
english: No matter what I ask, he answers only that he does not know.

translation: Not
explanation: An archaic auxiliary that indicates negation.
japanese: その日本人は英語が分からぬようだった。
reading: その日本人は英語が分からぬようだった。
english: That Japanese did not seem to understand English.

translation: Not
explanation: An archaic auxiliary that indicates negation.
japanese: 最近は滅多に酒を飲まぬが、若い頃はよく飲んだものだ。
reading: 最近は滅多に酒を飲まぬが、若い頃はよく飲んだものだ。
english: I seldom drink these days, but I used to drink a lot when I was young.

translation: Not
explanation: An archaic auxiliary that indicates negation.
japanese: 日本語が話せる者はこの辺にはおらぬ。
reading: 日本語が話せる者はこの辺にはおらぬ。
english: In this area there are not people who can speak Japanese.

explanation: A phrase which expresses the speaker's respect for someone when describing that person's action or state.
japanese: お急ぎですか。
reading: お急ぎですか。
english: Are you in a hurry?

explanation: A phrase which expresses the speaker's respect for someone when describing that person's action or state.
japanese: 今お持ちのカードはもう使えません。
reading: 今お持ちのカードはもう使えません。
english: You can no longer use the card you have now.

explanation: A phrase which expresses the speaker's respect for someone when describing that person's action or state.
japanese: もう皆さんお集まりです。
reading: もう皆さんお集まりです。
english: Everybody is here (literally: has gathered) now.

explanation: A phrase which expresses the speaker's respect for someone when describing that person's action or state.
japanese: 河野さん、課長がお呼びですよ。
reading: 河野さん、 課長[かちょう]がお呼びですよ。
english: Mr. Kono, the Section Chief wants to see you (literally: is calling you).

explanation: A phrase which expresses the speaker's respect for someone when describing that person's action or state.
japanese: コピーはもうお済みですか。
reading: コピーはもうお済みですか。
english: Have you already finished copying?

explanation: A phrase which expresses the speaker's respect for someone when describing that person's action or state.
japanese: どんな人をお望みですか。
reading: どんな人をお望みですか。
english: What kind of person would you like?

explanation: A phrase which expresses the speaker's respect for someone when describing that person's action or state.
japanese: お客様はまだお帰りじゃありません。
reading: お客様はまだお帰りじゃありません。
english: The guests haven't left (literally: gone home) yet.

explanation: A phrase which expresses the speaker's respect for someone when describing that person's action or state.
japanese: お疲れでしたらこの部屋でしばらくお休み下さい。
reading: お疲れでしたらこの部屋でしばらくお休み下さい。
english: If you are tired, please take a rest in this room for a while.

explanation: A phrase which expresses the speaker's respect for someone when describing that person's action or state.
japanese: 今お使いのワープロはいつお買いになりましたか。
reading: 今お使いのワープロはいつお買いになりましたか。
english: When did you buy the word processor you are using now?

explanation: A phrase which expresses the speaker's respect for someone when describing that person's action or state.
japanese: 先生は今何をご研究ですか。
reading: 先生は今何をご研究ですか。
english: What are you researching now, Professor?

explanation: A phrase which expresses the speaker's respect for someone when describing that person's action or state.
japanese: 天皇陛下がご訪問の国々はどうですか。
reading: 天皇陛下がご訪問の国々はどうですか。
english: Which countries is the Emperor going to visit?

translation: Starting with; not only ~ but also ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to give a primary example.
japanese: 私のうちでは、父をはじめ（として）、家族全員スポーツが好きだ。
reading: 私のうちでは、父をはじめ（として）、家族全員スポーツが好きだ。
english: In my family, starting with my father, all of us like sports.

translation: Starting with; not only ~ but also ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to give a primary example.
japanese: キャシーは、寿司をはじめとして、日本食なら何でも食べる。
reading: キャシーは、寿司をはじめとして、日本食なら何でも食べる。
english: Starting with sushi, Cathy eats any Japanese cuisine.

translation: Starting with; not only ~ but also ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to give a primary example.
japanese: 今年は大阪をはじめ、関西地方はどこも梅雨が短かった。
reading: 今年は大阪をはじめ、関西地方はどこも梅雨が短かった。
english: This year, starting with Osaka, the rainy season was short in all parts of the Kansai district.

translation: Starting with; not only ~ but also ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to give a primary example.
japanese: この会社は、社長をはじめとして、社員一同が同じ食堂で昼ご飯を食べている。
reading: この会社は、社長をはじめとして、社員一同が同じ食堂で昼ご飯を食べている。
english: At this company, starting with the president, all the employees eat lunch in the same cafeteria.

translation: Starting with; not only ~ but also ~
explanation: A phrase that is used to give a primary example.
japanese: この事件には、警察をはじめ、近くの住民が皆強い興味を示した。
reading: この事件には、警察をはじめ、近くの住民が皆強い興味を示した。
english: Not only the police but also the nearby residents showed a strong interest in this incident.

translation: Please do something.
explanation: A phrase which expresses a highly polite request.
japanese: 少々お待ち下さい。
reading: 少々お待ち下さい。
english: Please wait a moment.

translation: Please do something.
explanation: A phrase which expresses a highly polite request.
japanese: 電話でご注文下さい。
reading: 電話でご注文下さい。
english: Please order by phone.

translation: Please do something.
explanation: A phrase which expresses a highly polite request.
japanese: このペンをお使い下さい。
reading: このペンをお使い下さい。
english: Please use this pen.

translation: Please do something.
explanation: A phrase which expresses a highly polite request.
japanese: 時間があまりありませんのでお急ぎ下さい。
reading: 時間があまりありませんのでお急ぎ下さい。
english: Please hurry because we don't have much time.

translation: Please do something.
explanation: A phrase which expresses a highly polite request.
japanese: どうぞお気軽にご相談下さい。
reading: どうぞお気軽にご相談下さい。
english: Please feel free to consult with us.

translation: Please do something.
explanation: A phrase which expresses a highly polite request.
japanese: 便利でお得な周遊券をご利用下さい。
reading: 便利でお得な周遊券をご利用下さい。
english: Please use excursion tickets, which are convenient and economical.

translation: Seem; appear; apparently
explanation: A verb that indicates what the speaker/writer feels spontaneously or his/her hesitation about asserting himself/herself.
japanese: 来年の景気は今年よりもいいように思われる。
reading: 来年の景気は今年よりもいいように思われる。
english: It seems that the business conditions of the coming year will be better than those of this year.

translation: Seem; appear; apparently
explanation: A verb that indicates what the speaker/writer feels spontaneously or his/her hesitation about asserting himself/herself.
japanese: この病気の治療は約一か月かかると思われる。
reading: この病気の治療は約一か月かかると思われる。
english: It appears that the treatment of this disease will take approximately one month.

translation: Seem; appear; apparently
explanation: A verb that indicates what the speaker/writer feels spontaneously or his/her hesitation about asserting himself/herself.
japanese: 日本の輸出は今後あまり伸びないように思われる。
reading: 日本の輸出は今後あまり伸びないように思われる。
english: It seems that Japanese exports are not going to grow so much in the future.

translation: Seem; appear; apparently
explanation: A verb that indicates what the speaker/writer feels spontaneously or his/her hesitation about asserting himself/herself.
japanese: 子供の非行を犯罪映画に結び付けるのは短絡的なように思われる。
reading: 子供の非行を犯罪映画に結び付けるのは短絡的なように思われる。
english: It appears too simplistic to relate children's delinquency to crime movies.

translation: Seem; appear; apparently
explanation: A verb that indicates what the speaker/writer feels spontaneously or his/her hesitation about asserting himself/herself.
japanese: この大学の教育は理工系が特にいいように思われる。
reading: この大学の教育は理工系が特にいいように思われる。
english: Education at this university seems to be particularly good in science and engineering.

translation: Seem; appear; apparently
explanation: A verb that indicates what the speaker/writer feels spontaneously or his/her hesitation about asserting himself/herself.
japanese: 二十一世紀は情報化がもっと進んで、世界が一つの共同体になるだろうと思われる。
reading: 二十一世紀は情報化がもっと進んで、世界が一つの共同体になるだろうと思われる。
english: It seems to me that in the 21st century society will become more information oriented, and the world will become one community.

translation: Seem; appear; apparently
explanation: A verb that indicates what the speaker/writer feels spontaneously or his/her hesitation about asserting himself/herself.
japanese: 日本語を習う時はローマ字を使わない方がよいと思われる。
reading: 日本語を習う時はローマ字を使わない方がよいと思われる。
english: When you learn Japanese it seems better not to use romanization.

translation: Seem; appear; apparently
explanation: A verb that indicates what the speaker/writer feels spontaneously or his/her hesitation about asserting himself/herself.
japanese: 健康管理には毎日三十分ぐらいの運動をするのが効果的だと思われる。
reading: 健康管理には毎日三十分ぐらいの運動をするのが効果的だと思われる。
english: To look after your health, it is apparently effective to exercise for about 30 minutes every day.

translation: Be ~ and
explanation: Vます of the auxiliary verb おる.
japanese: この入口は従業員専用になっており、一般の人はここからは入れない。
reading: この入口は従業員専用になっており、一般の人はここからは入れない。
english: This entrance is for employees only and other people (literally: general people) cannot enter from here.

translation: Be ~ and
explanation: Vます of the auxiliary verb おる.
japanese: 彼は最近プラモデルに凝っており、暇さえあれば模型の飛行機に組み立てている。
reading: 彼は最近プラモデルに凝っており、暇さえあれば模型の飛行機に組み立てている。
